11.content:
*****Greg*****

Age: 18
Appearance: 5'9 feet tall, and 140 lbs. Short red hair and blue eyes. Rather average build. Wears the dread fighter outfit with dark blue armor instead of red.
Personality: Shy, but friendly and helpful.
Origin: In a village named Kirada in the Outrealms. Kirada is a quaint little town surrounded by plains and hills, with the ocean some distance away. Large mountains loom in the distance.
Bio: A wanderder who is traveling through the Outrealms. He left his family behind after deciding that he felt a disturbance. He is well traveled and strong, possessing many powerful items he has found. However, there are many Outrealms that he has yet to see for himself. He travels on his own, despite the insistance of his sister. At the beginning of this story, Greg finds himself in a major conflict.
Race: Human
Class: Dread Fighter (Level 30)
Uses: Swords (Level A), Axes (Level C), and Tomes (Level A)
Asset and Weakness: Speed and Luck
Equipment: Zenith (forged brave sword), Mjolnir, Book of Naga, and an Elixir.
Skills: Armsthrift, Sol, Limit Breaker, Ignis, and Aggressor

*****End******

And now the story begins.
11.title: Character #1

111.content:
"Ugh, just my luck!"

Greg groaned as he ducked out of the way of an incoming magic spell, ducking in the trenches created by the army he was assisting.

When he set out as an explorer from his home of Kirada, he didn't exactly imagine being caught up in a war. As if there weren't enough wars throughout the realms before. However, this didn't seem to be an ordinary war. He had set upon a land being threatened by phantom warriors- known as Einherjar. Nobody knows where they came from, but they had a knack for destruction, and this place was no exception.

And so the world of Nordion was enveloped by the war against the Einherjar.

"Get the knight squad up to the front! Don't give them an easy pass!" commanded Greg.

"Yes sir!" said a soldier.

Greg had no experience in war, but he was a trained fighter himself. He had studied a bit as a tactician, but not very much. Still, it was enough to get him through. He was a competent fighter, and could hang with some of the best from his home. However, that sometimes paled in comparison to other realm soldiers.

But that was beside the point. Greg had to duck again to avoid a sea of arrows, inching up against the side of the trench. He was just traveling when he got roped in by the locals, hoping for a fighter like him to help them. Greg hated being in a war but, thanks to his nature, he ended up helping them.

He was surely regretting it.

"I've got half a mind to leave, but then these people might die. Ugh, think Greg!" he reprimanded himself. What would Dad do in this situation? Probably joke about it while Mom hit him. Greg amused himself with a little laugh there.

His chuckle was interrupted with another nearby explosion.

"Sheesh, Einherjar pack a punch." said Greg.

Suddenly, one Einherjar jumped up and appeared to have the edge on him. However, light poured through Greg's fingers as he held his hand out.

"Book of Naga!" His light spell repelled the warrior, killing it easily. However, the spell took quite a bit of energy so Greg had to catch his breath for a bit.

"No end to them." he groaned.
111.title: Fighting a war

1112.content:
Greg fought alongside all the other soldiers around him as the Einherjar made a steady advancement. It became harder and harder for Greg to hold them back.

"How many are there?" Greg yelled over the roar of the battlefield. He soon felt that the next wave was on top of him when he saw a massive explosion, which Greg recognized as a spear tearing apart the incoming Einherjar. Greg turned and saw a man in armor similar to a paladin's on a brown horse.

-------------

Name: Jacob

Gender: Male

Weapons: Spear, Sigurd's lance, Silver Sword, Sol.

Skills: Limit Breaker, Luna, Ignis, Armsthrift, Miracle.

Class: Paladin. Wears white and blue armor.

Bio: A paladin at heart, Jacob only wishes the best for others. However hard he may try, he still seems a bit clumsy as he tries to carry lances and other things. Jacob has tried his hand at tomes, which he's fairly good at. But ended up with swords and lances.

-----------------

Jacob looked across the line and saw something glisten through the smoke. An arrow through flew and pierced his chest. He fell off the horse which ran off and clutched his chest. Greg jumped from the trench and ran toward him. "You alright?" Was all Greg got out before he heard roaring and saw another wave incoming. He pulled one of Jacob's arms over his shoulder and shouted, "Fall back!"

Greg ran, trying to get Jacob to safety when...
1112.title: Retreat to a safer spot

11121.content:
Barely holding Jacob up, Greg tried to get them both away from the main line of fire.

"You holding up there?" asked Greg.

"Yeah, just a little blood loss. I think I can live." said Jacob, trying stay on his feet as well.

"Come on, let's at least get you away from the line of fire." said Greg as he limped with Jacob away from the armies and into the nearby woods. However, he could still feel arrows and magic spells being launched into the woods, a few of them almost hitting them.

"Sheesh, these Einherjar don't give up." grumbled Greg as he and Jacob limped through. As they walked through, Greg suddenly saw something in the distance. It looked a bit like an Outrealm Gate, but it was smaller, and the blue energy inside swirled differently than a normal gate.

"Should we go through the gate? It could give us some time to recover from this." said Greg.

"I think a retreat would be wise right now. I'm not much use with this wound." said Jacob.

"Gate it is then." grumbled Greg as he tried to rush them both towards the gate, avoiding any wayside arrows and magic spells coming through. One javelin nearly missed them.

"Just who are they aiming for?" grumbled Greg as he and Jacob approached the gate. The differences the gate had from a normal gate worried Greg a bit, but he didn't have time to analyze the situation. He had to do what was best for him and Jacob right now. Greg hoisted Jacob up and jumped them both through the gate.

The energy inside the gate felt like nothing Greg ever felt before. He couldn't even keep himself awake as the energy swirled around him. Jacob soon lost consciousness, and Greg soon followed as the energy engulfed him too.

After a while

Greg slowly woke up to a bright blue sky, his body feeling groggy as he tried to move. He couldn't put his finger on it, but he felt....wierd. Like something was off. He slowly moved his head up, and his view was obstructed by two small mounds on his chest.

"What?" cried Greg as he sat up. He was wearing a grandmaster outfit, but not one for a guy. His limbs were smaller, and he could see his thighs beneath the outfit, with slight heels on his boots. He push his hand to his head and felt short purple hair on his head.

He then turned around and saw a red-haired girl wearing red armor and yellow clothes underneath slowly get on her hands and feet. Their faces met for a split second.

"Oh crap."
11121.title: ...he notices an odd gate

111211.content:
Jacob felt the two new assets on her chest push against the breastplate she wore as she was on her hands and knees.

And she was currently looking at the face of who he believed was the man that saved him as a woman with purple hair.

"What just happened?" Jacob said in her new voice. It surprised her initially since it sounded authoritative.

The purple hair woman shook her head, "I wouldn't know!"

Jacob looked down and saw red hair hang from her head. She then realized that her wound was still there, but healed a bit. She saw Greg stand and reach a hand out. Jacob took it reluctantly as she stood with Greg. "Thanks. Well now what?"

They the heard a noise nearby and saw a brown horse approaching them with no rider.

Jacob did another look at her armor and realized it was Paladin armor. "Come on," Jacob said as she approached the horse as she and Greg mounted it and rode it down a road.

"You think any of those Einherjar followed us?" Greg asked.

If they did, then they're in for a surprised," Jacob smirked as they rode down the road.

What happens next?
111211.title: New Identities

1112111.content:
The two of them rode the horse for a considerable distance. Greg began to lose track of time. Looking up at the sky, she imagined that it was a little past noon or so. The horse even seemed to be slowing down a bit.

"Hey, I think we should take a break." said Greg. "No one seems to be following us, and the horse could use the rest."

"Good idea." said Jacob as she turned the horse a bit off the main road they found. There was a nearby stream, where the horse could get a drink and Jacob and Greg could finally clean their face after who knows how long in that war.

As Jacob splashed water on her face, she looked at her reflection. She looked considerably older than before, perhaps in her early 30's. However, she looked fairly beautiful for that age, looking quite youthful. Her white armor looked rather clean against her red clothes. She looked to the side, seeing the other girl with her, a considerably younger one, possibly in late teens.

"You know, I never introduced myself. My name is Jacob, or at least it was anyway." said Jacob, holding her hand out to Greg, who took the hand as well.

"I'm Greg." she said before looking over Jacob. "You look like Titania, the Scarlet Paladin. I heard she was quite the warrior."

Jacob smirked. "Not quite as famous as who you are. Katarina, the Lost Tactician. Said to have led great armies for the Hero-King." she said, making Greg blush a bit.

"Well, I'm hardly able to live up to her legacy. I'm not that good at strategy." said Greg.

"You were good enough to save me, so I think you're alright." smirked Jacob before helping Greg up.

They looked through their inventory, seeing that they even had new weapons to help out with their new forms. Greg had a Katarina's Bolt and an Eliwood's Blade. Jacob had a silver lance and a Titania's Axe.

"Well, that was a good break. Shall we get going? We need to see which realm we're in." said Jacob who mounted the horse, Greg following suit.

"You're right." said Greg. "Funny, I figured you and I would be freaking out more over this."

"Well, war has a tendency to get other things off the mind. Who knows what will happen once it settles." said Jacob.

"Fair enough. Let's get to town." said Greg.

With that, they were off again, hoping to get some answers in the nearby settlement.
1112111.title: Along the way

11121111.content:
They rode down the road a little while longer. Jacob began to doze off and felt tired as she leaned against her horse. She felt a hand on her shoulder, "You feeling okay Jacob?" Greg asked.

Jacob looked back and smiled. "Thanks, but I'm fine. Just tired is all," Jacob said smiling back to Greg warmly when they reached a hill on the road and saw a city in the distance.

"Looks like we found civilization," Greg said. "Come on, let's hurry."

Jacob made the horse hurry toward the city as it galloped closer to the gates. Upon reaching it, Jacob dismounted the horse as Greg stayed in top and walked toward a stable. A few people stopped to look at them as they passed by. "Why do you think they're looking at us like that Greg?" Jacob asked curiously.

"Probably surprised to see the co-leader of the Greil Mercenaries and the tactician for the Hero-King in the same place at once." Greg said with a smile. She hopped off the horse's back as Jacob placed her horse in the stable. She turned and walked by Greg as they entered the city. It was large as people roamed the streets every which way and that. "This is incredible!"

Jacob nodded. Greg looked over and saw Jacob with tired eyes. "I suppose this day has been a long, hard and surprising one at that." Greg said with a smile. "Let's rest somewhere."

The two found an inn and sat outside it, not yet going in. "So what do you think?" Jacob asked Greg.

"Huh?"

"How long do you think we'll be like this?" Jacob asked.

Greg shrugged. "Not sure, but I'm too intrigued to leave now. Let's stick around and see what we can find out."

Jacob smiled and nodded, "Agreed."

What happens next?
11121111.title: Finding civilization

111211111.content:
With the Einherjar war still fresh on their minds, Greg and Jacob just sat there for a while.

"Wow, this is one bustling city. Any idea what it's called?" asked Jacob.

"I think it's called Niden." said Greg, the word just coming out of his mouth.

"And how did you know that?" asked Jacob.

"Hmm, I don't know actually. The name just came to mind. Maybe I noticed it somewhere when we entered the city." said Greg.

"I guess." said Jacob, although he wasn't too sure. He leaned back and sighed.

"When I woke up this morning, I never imagine by it's end that I'd be a woman." said Jacob.

"A famous one at that." smiled Greg.

"You as well. I'm sure being the Lost Tactician herself will net you a few jobs around here." smiled Jacob. Greg blushed a bit at that.

"Oh no, I'm not that good." he said.

"Funny, you seemed to be more sure of yourself back in Nodion. You alright?" asked Jacob.

"Yeah I'm fine. Just trying to get settled is all." said Greg. She looked up towards the castle that seemed to loom in the distance. It felt as if something was there for her to follow, but she wasn't sure what.

"But seriously, this city is huge. Could get lost easily here." said Jacob.

"Yeah." said Greg. "Hey, I'm gonna go look around and see what kind of shops they have here. See you in a bit."

"Oh, well okay. Stay safe." said Jacob as Greg ran into the crowd.
111211111.title: They rest

1112111112.content:
Jacob sat there for a while longer. A few people glanced at her as they walked by. Jacob looked at her reflection in the mirror and saw she looked exactly like Titania. "Wow," Jacob said to herself, still in disbelief, "The Scarlet Paladin herself..."
Name: Titania

Class: Great Knight

Weapons: Titania's Axe, Silver sword, Spear

Gender: (Once male) Female

Appearance: Red armor with white clothing underneath.

Skills: Axefaire, Lancebreaker, Discipline, Limit Breaker, Movement +1.

--------------

Jacob finally decided that she should at least find something to do while Greg was gone. Jacob stood and began walking when he felt....

Well she couldn't describe it, she just felt all...antsy. She felt like she needed to do something, then she saw a training barracks nearby. "Maybe I should train a little as Titania." Jacob said as she entered.

Approaching the soldier who kept the barracks records was a bit shocked to see Jacob. With as little much as a "Hello" and a "Please" she was allowed for training. She held her axe in her hand, which felt good for some reason and began swinging at targets filled with hay. She switched between her axe to a sword to a lance to a spear and everything inbetween.

She finally walked out with a bit of a sweat, a little exhausted when she decided to see her horse at the stables. She entered and found the horse. It was armored from head to hoof with metal. She detached the headpiece of armor and brushed the brown horse's mane. "Not only am I Titania but I have her horse?...I don't know if I should enjoy this or not." Jacob mused to herself.

She stood a little later and walked through the town in blazing heat. When Jacob finally returned to the hotel, she was sweating. Her hair was damp and her body was tired. "Guess I should rest up after everything that's happened."

She entered the hotel and rented and room and waited for Greg to return.

What happens next?
1112111112.title: Meanwhile....

11121111122.content:
Greg walked through the streets, looking at the various wares they had. They seemed to have everything, from the essentials to the more extravagant. Quite a few of the merchants there actually tried to suggest stuff to her.

"Hey there pretty lady, I bet this will look perfect on you." smiled one merchant who was selling a necklace. Greg wasn't quite sure how a girl would act in this situation, but she tried to let him down nicely.

"Um, it's okay. I'm not that high on gold right now." she sheepishly laughed as she backed away from the merchant.

"Man, being a girl is tough. Everyone likes to give me stuff. Is this how guys always act from this viewpoint?" sighed Greg. He remembered hitting on a few girls back in Kirada. Was this how they felt? Greg wasn't sure.

However, as she kept walking, she saw a little library to the side. Something inside her seemed intrigued by the little store, and before she knew it she walked inside and began looking.

"Funny. I never read that many books in Kirada." said Greg as she grabbed one random book off the shelf. To her surprise, it was a book on battle strategy. Immediately, Greg felt intrigued by the book, and found a nearby seat to read. As she opened it and began to read, she found her entire attention span taken up by the book.

"Wow, this book is fascinating. I could use this later on. Perhaps there are others." said Greg, getting up with the book in hand. She walked through the book shelves, finding at least 3 more books she was interested in.

When she found them all, she went over and paid for them. They didn't cost a lot, so that was good for her. When she got them all, she walked out of the store, her strategy book underneath her arms, and the rest in a bag.

"Funny, I never had that much interest in books. Is there a reason I like to read them?" she asked herself. As she said that, she saw a cloaked figure walking around near the alleys. It looked a bit suspicious, so Greg followed the figure closely. The figure seemed to see him, but didn't panic and turned a corner to an unoccupied alley. Greg walked in behind it, until they were out of common view.

"Didn't think I would see you here so soon." smiled the figure who flipped his cloak back, revealing itself to be Marth. Greg gasped a bit at seeing the Hero-King right in front of him. However, something seemed to trigger inside him. Something that felt different.

"Lord Marth! What are you doing here?" asked Greg, as if she knew him personally. Marth chuckled.

"I enjoy walking among my people sometimes. Unfortunately, a cloak is the only way for me to do it without being mobbed." he chuckled again, which made Greg giggle. to her slight surprise. "I must say though that I didn't expect you to be back so early."

"Early?" asked Greg.

"Yes. You left some time ago to see new places, explore, and learn new things. You seem to be a bit more well traveled now." he smiled.

"Well, I have been exploring for sure." mumbled Greg.
11121111122.title: Book shopping

111211111222.content:
Greg talked longer with the Hero-King about everything that has happened while she was "gone". Greg felt giddy with excitement, telling him about these tactics and battles she heard of. Marth was amused and laughed from time to time when the sun began setting. "I believe that I should return before the guards begin worrying," Marth said pulling his hood up. "I wish to talk to you again sometime."

Greg nodded and smiled, "Yes sir!" She said in a happy voice. They then parted ways as Greg walked through the streets carrying her books.

"I suppose I should find the inn. Jacob's probably there," Greg said. She soon found the inn and entered.

After a few moments of looking through a guest logbook, she found which room Jacob was in. She ascended the stairs and opened the door to the room when she found it. She walked in to see something a little unexpected.

Jacob was wearing a nightgown of somekind, but it seemed too small. She fidgeted with it, trying to get it around the new weight on her chest. And when she did it as best se could, much of her legs were exposed still. Jacob then realized Greg was there and let out, to his surprise, a small shriek.

"G-Greg! H-How long have you been there?" Jacob cried with her face getting redder and redder.

Greg put a hand to her hip and smiled, "Seeing how you were doing. And now that I see what you're doing, I must ask. How's it going?"

Jacob's face blushed red as she tried to reposition her nightgown. "There wasn't anyway I was gonna sleep in that armor, so a merchant offered me a nightgown. But it's too tight!" Jacob sighed and sat on the bed when she saw Greg still looking. "Can you stop staring?" Jacob asked embarrassed.

What happens next?
111211111222.title: Later on

1112111112221.content:
After Jacob got settled between her covers, Greg sat by on a chair and began to read.

"So what did you do today?" asked Jacob.

"Oh, I meet King Marth today. He was so happy with all the battle strategies I told him." smiled Greg.

"Huh?" asked Jacob. At that, Greg shook her head and refocused herself.

"Well, I did meet him honestly. He did seem happy at everything I told him. He's every bit as nice as the legends say." smiled Greg. Jacob smiled as well, feeling happy for her.

"Well, good for you. At least you met somebody today. I just trained and sweat all day long." smirked Jacob.

"Well, if anything else, it helps keep that figure in good condition." smiled Greg as she went back to reading, crossing her legs as she did.

"Fair enough." said Jacob as she leaned back, tired as heck after everything that happened today. Some time later, Greg got a bookmark and closed her book, fascinated by what she read. She had a new appreciation for reading after what happened here today. Anyway, she thankfully had a nightgown of her own, which actually fit her, and she got into the bed next to Jacob as she turned any of the lights out.

The next morning

Greg got up yawning the next morning, stretching her limbs as she rolled out of bed. The sun shined brightly outside, signaling the beginning of a new day. Over on the other bed, she could see Jacob slowly getting up from sleep as well.

"I'm going to try and wash up first alright?" asked Greg, to which Jacob nodded sleepily.

Before long, both of them were up and fully clothed.
1112111112221.title: End of Day

11121111122212.content:
Greg finished cleaning as she placed all of her books but one in a bag. Jacob left the room awhile ago as Greg got everything situated so she was ready to leave. Being a Tactician, she needed to be ready for anything.

She walked outside and saw Jacob on her horse as she turned and smiled. "Get on. I saw an Outrealm a little ways out." Jacob said as she reached a hand out.

Greg took it as Jacob hoisted her on the horse as they rode toward the exit and left the city.

Greg read from her book with one hand, using the other to balance herself on Jacob's hip. They rode past their original Outrealm gate they passed through, causing them to turn and look. "There it is." Jacob said, remembering when they passed through it before.

The other one appeared a few miles out as it sat in a field of grain, giving off it's ominous glow.

Greg hopped off the horse as Jacob stepped off, walked to it's head and held her head against it's head. "Go home," Jacob whispered to it, almost pained to leave it. The horse neighed and galloped away. Jacob turned back to Greg as they looked at the gate.

"Where does it go," Greg finally asked.

"Not sure," Jacob said. The two looked at one another and gave a determined nod as they entered.

What happens next?
11121111122212.title: Leaving town

111211111222121.content:
"This place looks as bad as the last one." said Jacob. As they walked through the gate, they still retained their current looks, although the air felt quite heavy around them. It was definately unlike any normal gate Greg had gone through before.

"Hopefully we get out soon then." said Greg.

As he said that, a light that normally signaled the end of a gate appeared, engulfing both of them in a burst of light.

The new realm

Greg slowly woke up to a bright blue sky, although the air felt thin around him.

"Where am I?" he asked before gasping and moving his hands to his mouth. His voice sounded higher, more so than it did in the last realm. He didn't seen any obstruction in his view, so he slowly tried to sit up. He was wearing a red mantle and robe over a simple dress, with simple sandals on his feet. Further more, his body looked....smaller.

"What?!" cried Greg as she stumbled to her feet. Looking down as she stood up, she saw that she looked like a child. She moved her hands over her body, feeling that it was about between 10-12 years old. She felt around her head, feeling purple hair tied up into ponytails on the sides of her head.

"What am I?" she asked herself. She looked around, seeing that she was in a rather mountainous region, with some plains. However, she was on the summit of a really high one right now. Looking to the side, she saw a small creek running by. Running over, she looked at her reflection.

"So...I'm Myrrh, the Great Dragon?" she asked herself. Wait, that meant she was a Manakete! The very idea of being part of the legendary dragon race both excited and frightened Greg. They were hailed for their power, but also feared for it. In all the legends he heard, from Elibe to Tellius, dragons always lived in secret.

Looking behind her, Greg saw a small round stone, shining yellow in the sunlight. She picked it up softly.

"So this must be my dragonstone. Heh, my dragonstone." giggled Greg, the very idea of actually having a dragonstone sounded so far-feteched.

Wait, where was Jacob?

"Jacob?!" called Greg, hearing no response. "Did he end up on another mountain?" she wondered.

Then, in the distance, she spotted something. A small town on a nearby summit. Greg wondered how anyone could live in this air, but she had no choice right now. Maybe Jacob ended up on another summit. She was sure Jacob would probably go to a town as well.

"Maybe I'll luck out and it'll be this one." said Greg as she held her dragonstone in hand. Of course, she had no idea how to use such a thing. How does one use a dragonstone? She grasped the stone in both hands, trying to figure that out. However, as that happened, two golden wings popped out of her back, thankfully harmlessly. The rest of her body glowed as she transformed in to a dragon.

"Unreal." said Greg, feeling a bit unnerved but also empowered by it. Anyway, she now had a way to get to the the town. Flapping her wings, she flew off, thankful that she could figure that out quickly.

*****Myrrh (Greg)*****

Gender: Female (formerly male)

Items: Dragonstone

Skills: Limit Breaker, Wyrmsbane, Swordbreaker, Sol, Strength+2

*****End bio*****
111211111222121.title: The next realm

1112111112221211.content:
Jacob opened his eyes as he stared up at the sky. He could feel the breeze against his body. Jacob groaned an unfamiliar groan, one that worried him. He looked around from where he sat, looking for Greg. "Greg?" Jacob called out. She quickly covered her mouth with one hand, it was another female voice.

Jacob sat up as she saw her body had gotten much smaller. She gasped at her new body. She was significantly smaller than her last two forms. She wore a light pink cape around her neck and a pink garb on her midsection with purple bands wrapped around her hands.. Jacob found a small pond and looked at her reflection and saw Tiki's face with her special ornament in her green hair. She couldn't believe, "Am I...Lady Tiki?" Jacob said in her voice. Jacob was shocked by this when he saw a pouch hanging from her waist. She reached in and pulled out a small stone.

"Wait, is this...?" Jacob began in her new voice. She held it in her hand when she suddenly saw a pink wall surround her. As fast as the change was, it was exhilarating as Jacob came out as a Divine Dragon. "Whoa..." Jacob said awestruck.

But he didn't have time to look at his new form, where did Greg go? Jacob flew up and saw a town, but he also saw a large dragon fly near him. Heading towards the town. Jacob chased it down. "Greg?!" Jacob yelled. The other dragon turned it's head and stopped flying as the two floated above the ground.

"Jacob! There you are, I was wondering where you were!" Greg said in a high-pitched voice. "What happened to us?"

"It looks like a Manakete realm," Jacob replied. "Look, let's land at the town and catch our bearings before we do anything else."

Greg agreed as the two dragons floated down toward the city.

-------------

Name: Jacob (Tiki)

Species: Manakete

Weapons: Dragonstone+ and etc.

Gender: Female

Skills: Limit Breaker, Wyrmsbane, Swordbreaker, Movement +1, Defender.

----------------

What happens next?
1112111112221211.title: Meanwhile with Jacob

11121111122212111.content:
"You look kind of funny." giggled Jacob as the two of them flew towards the little town.

"Me? You're just as weird." said Greg.

"Oh, I didn't mean anything bad by it. It's just that, isn't Myrrh the only dragon from the legends in which no one knows if she was a divine dragon or not?" asked Jacob. Greg thought about it for a second.

"I guess you're right. From what I hear, there weren't really different dragon types in Magvel. There seemed to be just one tribe, or at least one that was still alive when the Demon King supposedly returned." said Greg.

"I guess so. Then again, she was the daughter of the leader, so maybe she was a divine dragon in a sense." said Jacob before smiling. "Which makes you kind of like a Manakete Princess."

"What are you talking about? So are you? Tiki, the Little Divine Dragon? Only daughter to Naga? You're in a new class of royalty." said Greg. That caught Jacob a bit off-guard; she obviously hadn't considered that.

"I guess so, but it feels strange. I mean, being daughters of dragons. It's kind of weird, yet exciting." said Jacob.

"I know. I'm glad that flying seems to come second nature, otherwise we'd be stuck on those summits." said Greg. After she said that, both of them looked around.

"These mountains are pretty beautiful. Actually kind of....peaceful." said Jacob.

"Yeah, a sharp contrast to those other realms." sighed Greg.

Anyway, the two of them found the piece of elevated land where the town was, setting down on the ground. As they did, both of them released their dragon forms, seeing each other as little girls for the first time. They both took one look at each other and started to giggle; Jacob more so than Greg.

"Wow, we both look silly." said Jacob.

"True, but at least we're the same this time, unlike the last realm." said Greg.

Anyway, with that said, the two of them walked together towards the town, curious to find what kind of place it would be.
11121111122212111.title: Manakete Realm

choices: They test the new stones out.
111211111222121111.content:
As the two Manakete children walked through town, they saw a few surprising things. There were already a few of them who were children like them. A few were grown and looked majestic almost. The others they saw were human. The buildings and vendors in the city looked the same as any other, but from what the vendor's sold.

With her new child-like curiousity, Jacob couldn't resist. "Ooh!" She saw a row of stones that looked similar to Dragonstones on the vendor's cart. "Excuse me, sir? What are these?" Jacob asked in a manner that Greg couldn't help but giggle.

"Those are a variety of stones that Manakete like you can use to change how you transform." The vendor said with a wide grin.

Greg tapped Jacob in the shoulder, "I heard about those. They apparently change what you can do or what you are in your Manakete form."

Jacob smiled listening to the possibilities and bought a few, including a Firestone, a Earthstone, another Dragonstone, and an odd one called a Wyvernstone. They walked away with their new possessions.

"These could be fun to try out," Jacob said giddy with excitement.

Greg giggled, "Yeah, but first let's her something to eat. I'm a bit hungry."

Jacob nodded as the two found a bite to eat.

What happens next?
111211111222121111.title: Seeing the town

1112111112221211111.content:
The two kids stopped at a small shop, where they got themselves a bowl to eat.

"Wow, this place has some good food." said Jacob, who seemed to be more energetic as of late.

"Yes, it does." said Greg. Quite the opposite of Jacob, he was beginning to feel a bit more reserved. It didn't take long for them to finish their meals at all. Soon enough, they had paid and they were back on the road. However, soon after, a couple of Manakete kids ran up to them. One was a little girl with long black hair, and the other was a boy with red hair.

"Good day Princess Tiki!" bowed both of the kids. Both Jacob and Greg were a bit taken back.

"Looks like you really are royalty here." smiled Greg. Jacob looked a bit unnerved by it all.

"Are you taking a walk around town milady?" asked the girl.

"I...guess so." said Jacob, not quite sure how to react. She wanted to redirect the subject. "Oh, and this is..." she started before the kids interrupted again.

"And you're Princess Myrrh of Slovenia right?" asked the boy. "It's so cool to see someone from Slovenia here, much less their princess. My name is Rathe." said the boy.

"And I'm Miranda." she curtseyed.

"Oh, well I'm flattered." said Greg, surprisingly feeling okay with it. She was beginning to feel like she really had her emotions under control, which seemed to contrast with Jacob. Suddenly, Rathe spoke up again.

"By the way princess, have you meet the human swordsman yet?" he asked.

"Who?" asked Jacob.

"I heard the human prince is visiting Queen Naga. Must be pretty important. I think his name was Marth or something. I imagine it must involve you some how." said Rathe.

What's next?
1112111112221211111.title: They wander town

11121111122212111111.content:
As soon as those words left Rathe's mouth, a look of shock crossed Jacob's face. "Do you know where he is now?" Jacob asked excitedly.

"Last I saw him he was at the large temple here in town," Miranda said.

Jacob turned and saw the roof of what she believed was the temple. "Thanks! Come on Myrrh," Jacob yelled as she ran in the direction of the temple.

Greg chased her down. "Jacob? Jacob, wait!"

After a bit of running the two entered the temple. It was fairly large with hallways and columns. When she entered she saw Marth walking from behind. He hadn't noticed them yet. Jacob then ran towards him, jumped out and hugged his leg from behind. "Mar-Mar!" Jacob yelled happily and giggling as she hugged Marth's leg tightly.

Marth turned around surprised and then smiled to see Tiki wrapped around his leg. "Hey there Tiki," Marth said a he pulled Tiki off and knelt next to her. "It's good to see you again," Marth said, causing Tiki to giggle.

"You here to pray to Naga," Jacob asked with Tiki's curiousity.

Marth smiled and nodded, "Yes."

The two continued talking for awhile and when Tiki was about to leave, Marth stopped her. "I was gonna meet with Queen Naga. Would you like to come along?"

Tiki shook her head up and down nodding. "Yay! Come on Myrrh!"

Greg chuckled to herself and shook her head following them toward the Throne room.

What happens next?
11121111122212111111.title: Jacob reacts to hearing her "Mar-Mar"

111211111222121111111.content:
The three of them left the temple, heading towards the castle right beside it. The city castle was on it's own little piece of land, only connected to the town through a bridge. Of course, for Manaketes, the trip was no problem, and they often assisted any humans who needed to cross carefully.

"Wow, that's a long fall." said Greg as she took a quick look down. Perhaps it was because she had wings, but she didn't feel scared by the heights.

"I can fly you across Mar-Mar." offered Jacob. Marth chuckled.

"That's kind of you, but I can walk." he said, gong ahead to do just that.

"Wait for me!" called Jacob as she began to follow him. Greg followed soon after. They crossed the bridge easily, getting to the entrance and getting past the guards.

"Wow, this place is so different from Slovenia." awed Greg before putting a hand over her mouth. Where did that come from? She had never been anywhere else since coming here. Or did she?

"The throne room is just ahead! Come on!" said Jacob, grabbing Marth's hand and pulling him along excitedly. Greg sighed at her.

"I guess it's natural that Tiki would be such a kid right now." said Greg. Once again, she stopped. It was as if she was thinking of Tiki, and not Jacob. Shaking her head, Greg kept up with the others. Soon enough, they reached the throne room, where they were met with an amazing sight. It wasn't often that someone got to meet Naga in person, looking ever as radiant as ever. Greg awed at the dragon queen, never imaging that there was still a realm where she was alive. This truly was a special realm indeed.

"Hi mom!" chirped Jacob. Naga smiled.

"Ah, there you are Tiki. I was a bit worried as to where you had gone. Did you have to find her, Prince Marth? I apologize for any inconvenience." apologized Naga.

"Oh, it's all right. I enjoy Tiki's company." smiled Marth.

"I am happy to hear that, especially due to the reason why I asked you to come." said Naga.
111211111222121111111.title: Queen of Manaketes

1112111112221211111111.content:
Marth stood in front of Naga as Tiki and Greg watched from the side. "Our two nations have been so close these last few years King Marth. Wouldn't you agree?"

Marth nodded, "Of course, Queen Naga. Why do you ask?"

"I have been thinking of forming a union with your Kingdom. Humans and Manaketes could learn so much from one another, and could protect each other. Would you agree to join in a union with us?" Naga asked, as respectfully as possible.

Marth stood there for a few moments, when a big grin crossed his face and he turned to Tiki at the side. "What do you say Tiki? Do you like this idea?"

Tiki nodded up and down rapidly smiling. "Of course, Mar-M-" something stopped her as she shook her head and Jacob came back. "Of course, King Marth."

"Alright. Then it's settled. Come King Marth while we work out a few details." Naga said. She stood and walked along the columns as King Marth followed beside her discussing rules and terms.

Greg walked up beside Jacob, "Hey, you alright?"

Jacob nodded. "Yeah, I...I'm kinda tired." Jacob said.

What happens next?
1112111112221211111111.title: Naga's news

11121111122212111111111.content:
"What was Lady Naga talking about?" asked Greg.

"Honestly, I have no clue." said Jacob. "But it sounds kind of cool." she added. Greg just nodded.

"You okay? You seem a little mellow." said Jacob.

"Oh me? Well, this is how I usually am." said Greg. Jacob wasn't aware of Greg being that mellow, but she dropped it soon after. Anyway, that night, they got a good meal for dinner, as Naga was happy to have a nice dinner prepared for all of them and Prince Marth. Jacob didn't really ask about whatever Marth and Naga talked about. She didn't bring it up, so Jacob imagined that they would know tomorrow morning.

"Well, this seems to be my castle somewhat, so you can sleep with me." said Jacob.

"Oh, of course. Sure." said Greg, still acting a bit mellow. She was looking out the window as she said that.

"Are you alright? You sound like you miss something." said Jacob.

"Oh, it's not too much. I just wonder how Lord Ephraim is doing back in Slovenia. I hope he and his sister are okay." muttered Greg with her hands together as if in prayer. Jacob was a bit confused.

"Sorry, what do you mean?" asked Jacob.

"You know? Lord Ephraim? He's a human prince back in my home. I miss him a lot. He treats me so well." smiled Greg. Although, it was a smile that Jacob didn't really think was his, more like Myrrh's.

"Well..okay...if you say you feel okay." said Jacob.

Anyway, with the rooms they found, the two turned in for the night. Naga came in and kissed Jacob good night, something Jacob was happy to feel. She had to admit, being a parent, even if it is the dragon queen, was a pretty sweet deal.
11121111122212111111111.title: Resting for the night

111211111222121111111111.content:
Jacob woke up the next day and sat up in her bed and stretched. She looked over and saw Greg and woke her up. Greg woke up slowly as the two dragon kids woke up. "I wonder where Naga is?" Jacob said. Greg nodded as the two began walking around the castle.

"So what's it like to be a princess to The Naga?" Greg said smiling.

"It's cool," Jacob said. "I would never of thought of being in a position like this."

They walked around a bit longer when they saw Prince Marth. Tiki came back out of Jacob as she ran toward him. "Mar-Mar!" She chirped as she hugged him.

Marth smiled and hugged her, "Hey there. Hey, me and your Mom has something to say."

Tiki nodded, "Okay! What is it?"

Naga walked from behind Marth as she put her arms around his neck lightly and smiled, "I'm going to marry Prince Marth." Naga said smiling.

Tiki gasped as her mouth creased into a smile. "Mar-Mar!" She yelled and hugged him tightly. Marth laughed and hugged back.

Greg was shocked. To have Naga marry Prince Marth is insane. "We need to plan over a few things, Tiki. So you go play while we talk." Jacob finally let go and ran back to Greg grinning.

"Can you believe it?" Jacob said excitedly.

"It's pretty cool. Now Naga is your mom and Prince Marth is your dad." Greg said. "I wanted to explore a bit more. Wanna come along?"

"Sure!"

What happens next?
111211111222121111111111.title: Waking up the next morning

111211111222122.content:
As the two of them entered the new Outrealm Gate, Greg felt something wash over him. As it faded down, he looked at himself, seeing that he was normal again.

"Phew, I'm me again." sighed Greg. He then looked to the side, seeing Jacob get up alongside him.

"Oh, I'm myself again. Thank goodness. I couldn't imagine being her for a long time." said Jacob.

"Oh, it wasn't so bad. You were quite the figure." said Greg.

"You were more so. Being Katarina must have been fun." said Jacob.

"I don't know. Her history was a bit dubious." sighed Greg.

"Meh, only for a little while. She was quite the tactician after all." smiled Jacob who allowed Greg to help him to his feet fully. Once they were both of, they both continued walking through the gate.

"I wonder if there are other realms that cause transformations." said Greg.

"I imagine there are. And possibly weirder ones too." said Jacob.

"I guess so." said Greg.

As he said that, a bright burst of lightr engulfed them, signaling that they were close to the next realm. Greg could only imagine where they were going to end up next.
111211111222122.title: Another realm

1112111112221221.content:
Jacob opened his eyes as he felt his body slumped against something hard. His body felt weird and tingly all over. Jacob put a hand to his head which felt light-headed. Jacob pulled his knees closer when he saw that they were actually "her" knees. Jacob saw that most of her thighs were shown from under silver Pegasus armor.

Jacob looked at herself. "Ah great," she said in her new voice. She saw a small creek nearby as she looked over at her reflection. She had long silver hair cascading from her head and two pegasi wings in her hair. Jacob blushed a bit, surprised at her new form's elegance and stature. Jacob would've paid more attention when she realized Greg wasn't around. "Greg? Great, where is he?"

Jacob then saw an Outrealm gate and a field nearby, as the grass moved, he saw something in it. "Greg!" Jacob yelled as she ran toward the one in the field.

---------

Name: Jacob (Sumia)

Gender: Female

Class: Pegasus Knight

Weapons: Silver lance, Javelin, Killer Lance.

Skills: Sol, Lancefaire, Discipline, Galeforce, Limit Breaker.

--------

What happens next?
1112111112221221.title: Awakening

11121111122212211.content:
Greg felt even more out of it than usual this time. Guess this Outrealm Gate had a bit more force to it than the others. She felt sore all over her body at this, groaning as her eyes fluttered open.

"Ugh....what hit me...." groaned Greg. By now, the presence of a female voice didn't overly surprise her, given the last realm she was in. This time, she saw that she was face-down in the ground, seeing some dirt on herself.

"Who am I this time?" she whispered to herself. As she said that, a long mane of red hair covered her face, causing her to comb it out of her face.

She sat up on her knees, seeing that she was wearing silver pegasus knight armor over red clothing. Her hair flowed down to her rear, and she had a couple of tiny pegasus knight decorations in her hair. She saw a Brave Lance over to the side. Grabbing it, she used it to prop herself up.

"Greg!" She heard a voice call out. Greg turned and saw a purple-clad pegasus knight running over, before tripping and falling to the ground right before reaching her.

"Ouch!" cried the girl.

"Jacob, is that you?" saig Greg. Jacob got up, brushing the dirt off her uniform.

"Yes, it's me. Gues you're the same as me this time." she said.

"I guess so, but I've never seen this girl before. Out of all the Einherjar I've heard of, this is new." said Greg.

"I guess so. I don't recognize this girl either, although I wonder why I just tripped like that for no good reason." groaned Jacob. Greg giggled lightly at that bit of news.

*****Cordelia (Greg)*****

Gender: Female
Class: Falcon Knight
Weapons: Brave Lance, Javelin, Spear
Skills: Galeforce, Limit Breaker, Sol, Armshrift, Lancefaire.

*****End bio*****
11121111122212211.title: Greg

111211111222122111.content:
They stood looking at each other for a moment when they heard something coming. "What's that noise," Greg asked as they looked around. Jacob turned and saw a giant white horse with wings coming toward right in front of her. Jacob let out a little yell and fell on her butt.

"Oof!" Jacob said as she then looked back up at the Pegasus above her. "Greg, you seeing th-" Jacob began when she saw Greg petting her own pegasus's mane.

Greg walked over and helped Jacob up again. "Looks like we became Pegasus knights," Greg said. Jacob nodded and walked toward her Pegasus as she dusted herself off.

"So...should we ride them," Jacob asked.

"Don't see why not. We'll probably travel faster with them," Greg said. The two soon mounted the Pegasi, Jacob getting on normally since his horses were that different from Pegasi...besides the wings. The Pegasi lifted onto their hind legs as they soon took off. They saw a vast countryside full of green grass and fields.

"Whoa..." Jacob said in shock.

"Hey, what do you think that is?" Greg said to Jacob pointing at something.

Jacob looked and saw...

What happens next?
111211111222122111.title: Pegasi arrive

1112111112221221111.content:
The countryside looked fresh and green as the duo flew over the landscape. It was a refreshing scene for them, after seeing that oppressive war in Nodion. Greg in particular, enjoyed the sight.

"Wow, this place looks so peaceful." said Greg.

"Looks like it has had some of it's own problems though. I can still see some faint traces of a war. If I had to guess, it must have been a couple of years since a war broke out." said Jacob.

"I see....Well, at least they solved their problems. I'd like to see what happened here." said Greg.

"Me too." said Jacob before turning forward and gasping. "Woah! Look at that!"

Greg looked forward and gasped as well, seeing a huge city in the distance. It looked grand in all sense of the word.

"What is that place?" asked Greg.

"I don't know, but it feels familiar. I think it's called Ylisstol." said Jacob. Greg gave her an odd look.

"How did you know that?" asked Greg.

"I'm not sure, but.....it feels like home for some reason." said Jacob. Greg nodded.

"I see. Perhaps it's because of who you are now." said Greg. "Let's land." said Greg.

"Okay."

With that, the two of them landed their pegasi on the ground, dismounting them and bringing them along as they walked towards the city.

"I wonder how different this place is from the last realm." muttered Greg.
1112111112221221111.title: ...Ylisstol.

11121111122212211111.content:
The moment Greg and Jacob entered the city, people began to run up to Jacob. "Queen Sumia!" "Exalt!" "Naga bless you!" Shouts and shouts glorifying Jacob were calling out.

Jacob scratches the back of her head and smiled sheepishly, "Um...Th-thank you."

A few of the people split up as Greg turned to Jacob and asked, "What was that all about?"

"It sounded like...I'm their Queen," Jacob said surprised. "Guess I got lucky with who I became."

Greg nodded. "Looks like it. Maybe we should check around a little more...How about "your" castle," Greg asked with a grin.

Jacob smiled back, "Alright!" Jacob took two steps, tripped and fell as she dusted herself off and kept walking.

"Yep...That's gonna bruise."

-----------

Jacob entered the doors of the large castle when they saw a man with blue hair in a blue uniform with a single silver shoulder guard. "Sumia! I was wondering where you were."

"Chrom!" Jacob hollered back delighted. Greg was surprised that Jacob knew who the man was. Before he could intervene though...

What happens next?
11121111122212211111.title: People see the "Queen" enter

111211111222122111111.content:
However, before Jacob could inquire more about it, she heard a couple pairs of footsteps coming, along with the sound of a baby crying. She turned around and saw three figures: one was a girl with long blue hair, another with shorter blue hair into twin ponytails, and she was carrying a baby with her.

"Mom, little me is acting up again!" cried the girl with shorter hair.

"Little me?" thought both Jacob and Greg. However, the girl just gave Jacob the crying baby. All of a sudden, Jacob was holding the baby like an expert mother, even patting the baby's back and all that.

"Sorry Cynthia." said Jacob suddenly, not knowing where that name came from. "Where is little Lucina right now?"

"Sleeping in her crib, but Cynthia won't be quiet. Neither of them will actually." said the long-haired girl, holding her head as if having a headache.

"Hey Lucina, I'm not that loud." said Cynthia.

"I beg to differ." said Lucina.

"All right, enough you two. Lucina, I need you to come with me for a second. Sumia, Cynthia's been begging for someone to see her new battle cry. Think you can handle that while I get some matters settled?" asked Chrom.

"Oh, of course!" smiled Jacob.

"I'm so confused right now." said Greg. However, Chrom soon turned to her, and Greg felt her body tense up.

"Oh, and I believe Severa is looking for you Cordelia. She looked pretty mad too." said Chrom.

"Who's that?" asked Greg to herself, but she didn't question the order.
111211111222122111111.title: Cynthia and Lucina enter

1112111112221221111111.content:
Jacob felt a hand grab his arm as Cynthia began pulling Sumia toward one of the doors. "Great! I wanted show you my battle-cry, and if it's outside it will seem even louder!" Jacob laughed but then looked back to Greg and waved a quick wave as she was pulled through the doors.

----------

Jacob and Cynthia walked down one of the larger halls of the castle. "So what did ya think?" Cynthia asked with a trademark smile.

"It was great sweetheart. That'll be sure to stop a brigand in their tracks," Jacob grinned back.

Jacob entered a room while carrying the baby she was given earlier and laid her in a crib next to another one. She looked down at the two of them and smiled. Cynthia them walked up beside her. "I'm still trying to get use to seeing me as a baby."

This was still confusing to Jacob until she "remembered" where these two older kids came from. She turned and smiled, "I understand. Now I wonder where Cordelia is?"

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111.title: Cynthia drags "Sumia" away

choices: Greg stays with the little Severa
11121111122212211111111.content:
Meanwhile, Greg had walked in the opposite direction, heading towards part of the barracks where Chrom had suggested for her to go. She was a bit unsure about whatever she would find though. He kept mentioning a "Severa" but she couldn't figure out whom he was talking about.

"Maybe I'll find out soon enough. Sigh." for some reason, Greg found himself sighing more often now, like in almost every paragraph. It felt kind of weird honestly.

"Mommy!" Suddenly, she heard a couple of footsteps; one approaching rapidly and another being much slower. She turned her head and saw a little toddler, probably no more than 1 and a half years old, and an older girl walking behind her. Both girls looked very similar, each having hair as red as Greg's. The little girl ran up and tugged at Greg's boots.

"Are you done mommy?! Can I ride Khan now?!" she jumped excitedly. The girl behind her groaned.

"Why can't you stay still for one second? Gods."groaned the older girl before briefly smiling at Greg. "Hey mom, can you take care of little me?"

Suddenly, something seemed to come to Greg, as if remembering something from earlier. The memories of who this older girl was as well as the little one came back to her, and she smiled.

"Oh, sure Severa." said Greg as she picked up the little Severa. "Where are you going?"

"None of your business....but Owain said he had something to tell me, but I guess I shouldn't keep him waiting." said Severa.

"Oh, that's nice sweethart." smiled Greg. Severa blushed.

"Whatever," she groaned as she turned on her heel and walked off.

"Hmm, still as pleasant to talk to as ever" giggled Greg.
11121111122212211111111.title: Severa and Greg

111211111222122111111111.content:
Sumia sat alone in the crib room with little Cynthia finally asleep in the crib and little Lucina in her arms. She smiled as little Lucina was slowly falling to sleep. Out of the corner of her vision she saw the door open and saw Chrom lean through the doorway. He was about to speak when Sumia put a single finger to her lips, signaling for him to be silent. She then laid little Lucina back in her crib and walked out of the room with Chrom. "I was wondering where you were," Chrom asked smiling.

Sumia smiled back as she shrugged as the two walked down the hall. "Where are Lucina and Cynthia," Sumia asked.

"Practicing. Lucina with her sword skills, Cynthia with her theatrics."

Sumia giggled, "You know her, always looking to impress."

They were quiet a little while longer as they walked when Chrom asked, "Where'd you head off to today? I woke up and you were gone at first. You head outside the Kingdom?" Chrom asked curiously.

Sumia then remembered who she really was. Jacob looked back at Chrom. "Oh...yeah, I decided to take when of the Pegasi for a ride and just got caught up in the landscape. Sorry I didn't say anything."

Chrom smiled, "That's all right. As long as you're safe," he said.

Jacob smiled and continued walking along with Chrom. It was getting late and she needed to find Corde-...Greg soon.

What happens next?
111211111222122111111111.title: Back with "Sumia"

1112111112221221111111111.content:
"You better make it up to me. I've been forced to watch this kid all day." groaned Severa.

Greg was still a bit confused, but part of her felt okay with this situation, and she smiled at her "daughter". "Of course dear. We'll have your favorite for dinner, all right?"

"Better." smirked Severa.

"Mommy, riding was so fun!" smiled the little Severa in Greg's arms. Seeing the little girl happy seemed to bring out more feelings in Greg, and she felt herself acting in stride with it all.

"Maybe you'll be a pegasus knight too in a few years." smiled Cordelia.

"Yay!" laughed the little Severa. Meanwhile, the older one felt like gagging.

"Ugh, seeing myself act like that makes me wanna hurl." said Severa.

"Now now, be nice." smiled Cordelia.

As they talked, Severa finally got them to a nice house near the castle, where lots of knights and their families stayed. Cordelia entered, and Severa ran right over to a sleeping figure on the couch.

"Dad, wake up!" she yelled as she kicked him. Stahl immediately fell off, groaning as he staggered to his feet.

"Ugh, honey, was that really necessary?" said Stahl. He smiled though as Cordelia came into view. He came right over and kissed her. Cordelia felt pretty good, and kissed back.

"Would you like some dinner now?" she asked, as if she needed an answer.

"That would be nice." smiled Stahl.

Cordelia smiled, while Severa just groaned again.
1112111112221221111111111.title: Greg meets the rest of the family

11121111122212211111111111.content:
The sun was down now in Ylisstol. After Sumia made a meal for her husband and daughters, she went out to look for Cordelia. She wasn't sure why she was looking for Cordelia, but...it seemed important. Sumia walked through the streets at night. Since no one was around, she didn't have to be worried about being seen and crowded. She walked around a little longer before she felt her boot hit something (which was really nothing) and began to fall when a hand caught her. "You alright mother?" The voice asked her.

Sumia looked up and saw Lucina holding her. "Oh! Lucina, thanks. Sorry..." Sumia began, apologizing for her clumsiness.

Lucina just smiled, "It's alright."

"I wonder sometimes how you're so...balanced," Sumia said.

"Oh I'm not that great," Lucina said. "Remember when a smashed a hole in the wall with Falchion?"

Sumia giggled, "Yes. THAT, you got from your father."

Lucina laughed and finally said, "What are you doing out here anyway?"

"Well....I was looking for Cordelia," Sumia began.

"Oh. Well, it's quite late mother. I think it would be easier to catch her tomorrow."

Sumia thought about it and smiled, "Alright. Wanna head back to the castle with me?"

"Of course," Lucina replied.

The two walked away as they entered the castle. Lucina turned a hallway toward her room, telling Sumia Cynthia was already asleep. She walked into her bedroom and changed into a nightgown as Chrom entered. Chrom simply smiled, kissed her as she kissed back, and went to sleep next to each other with a "Good night," between the two of them.

What happens next?
11121111122212211111111111.title: Sumia in the castle

111211111222122111111111112.content:
The next morning, Cordelia woke up next to her husband. As the sun rays hit her, she slowly got up and stretched. As always, she got up pretty early, as to make sure to get some things done. It was part of her routine. She smiled though at Stahl as he continued to snooze, planting a kiss on his check.

"Okay, what's first?" she asked herself.

She put on a basic robe and walked into the kitchen. As she began to get some breakfast ready, she took a look at everything in the kitchen, checking what supplies they had.

"Hmm, we could use more flour, and I need some meat for that meal we're having in a couple days...." she began to trail off. As she kept talking to herself, her "two kids" came into the kitchen.

"Good morning mommy!" said little Severa as she hugged her mother's leg. Cordelia smiled as she looked down and picked up her little daughter.

"Good morning." she said, lightly kissing the toddler.

"And no one pays me any attention." pouted Severa as she took a seat at the table. Cordelia gave her "oldest" daughter a small smile.

"I can tell when you don't want anyone to talk to you." said Cordelia.

"Whatever." said Severa. "So is dad still in bed? Guess I should wake him up."

"Oh, let him sleep. It is his day off after all. He works hard." said Cordelia.

"Not much. Someone needs to light a fire under his ass sometimes." groaned Severa. Cordelia smiled while shaking her head. She enjoyed these little family moments. Something in her head felt as if something was off, but she shoved it aside as she made breakfast. She had her duties to get to afterwards.
111211111222122111111111112.title: The next day...

1112111112221221111111111121.content:
Sumia woke up in her bed alone. 'Hm? Oh, Chrom must already be up.' Sumia thought to herself as she stood up and loosened her muscles a bit. She changed into her Pegasus knight uniform after she washed up.

Immediately after doing so, she went off and began to make some food in the kitchen for breakfast. Sumia, after dropping her first batch, finally finished breakfast when she heard multiple footsteps approaching. She saw Lucina and Cynthia walk around the corner, each holding their littler versions.

"Good morning mother," Lucina said smiling as little Lucina added a "Hi mommy!", waving her little hand.

Cynthia replied similarly, saying "Hey mom," as her littler version waved giggling.

Sumia smiled a warm smile. "Good morning, my little angels. Breakfast's ready."

They each sat down and began eating, Sumia alternating between helping little Lucina eat and little Cynthia. She kissed each of her daughters as she was ready to leave, but forgot why. She remembered something about Cordelia, but she forgot what it was about. She felt something was off, that she was missing something important. That something was...beckoning to her. She shrugged it off as she headed toward the Pegasi stables. While there...

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111111121.title: Back in the castle

11121111122212211111111111211.content:
After walking down the castle steps (and tripping along the way), Sumia made her way towards the pegasi stables where her mount was. She smiled as she entered and patted the pegasus.

"Hey there girl. How are you this morning?" she smiled as she brushed the horse's hair a few times. Despite there being staff who did the horses and pegasi, she enjoyed doing such things herself.

"You taking care of her again?" smiled Cordelia as she walked in, all armored up and lance at the ready as usual. Sumia smiled as her childhood friend entered.

"Oh good morning, Cordelia! How are you?" she asked.

"Doing well enough. I honestly didn't imagine Severa being so...different with the little one." she said.

"Well, she does have her loving mother and father around now. I hear she wants to be a pegasus knight like you." said Sumia. "Is that true?"

"Oh yes, she does. She keeps begging me to let her ride Khan. I keep having to tell her though that she's not even 2 years old yet, so she can't fly on her own at all." sighed Cordelia. Sumia giggled.

"Well, she's motivated, just like her mother. I have to feed four little mouths after all." said Sumia.

"I hope you've improved enough where you don't need 10 tried to make a meal. That would not be good." said Cordelia. Sumia gasped and waved her hands in front of her.

"Oh no, I'm much better now. Now it generally takes me 2 or 3 tries to do it." she said. Cordelia raised an eyebrow.

"I guess that's better....in a matter of speaking." said Cordelia.

"Well anyway, perhaps you should bring little Severa to come over and play. I can tell that little Cynthia is going to have the same idea as the older one. I guess I'll have to make sure we have a few pegasi available in a few years." she smiled.

"Indeed." said Cordelia. Then after that, she straightened up.

"Anyway milady, I have to do my morning scout, so if you'll excuse me." she bowed.

"Cordelia, you know you don't have to bow. That being said, happy flying." smiled Sumia as she waved to Cordelia, who saddled up on Khan and took off into the sky. Sumia waved good-bye and turned to her own mount, tripping again as she walked back over.

"Ouch, that'll bruise." she groaned.
11121111122212211111111111211.title: Sumia finds Cordelia

111211111222122111111111112111.content:
"Look at me Mom!" Yelled Cynthia from her Pegasus, Cynthia the once "little" Cynthia.

---------

About 4 to 5 years passed since...something, Sumia remembered. Cynthia had finally grown up and got a Pegasus to ride on, while her "older sister", the future Cynthia began teaching her. Same was with little Lucina, now an older Lucina. Future Lucina began by giving her Falchion and teaching her how to swing it and use momentum and balance. From time to time, Sumia would teach Cynthia and Chrom would teach Lucina a bit more.

Sumia would see Cordelia from time to time on the streets, in the stables, or flying. She felt something though every time she saw or talked to Cordelia. Something...important, but the feeling began fading over time.

"Just remember to focus," Sumia said back as she flew her own Pegasus next to her daughter's. They both flew for sometime until the two landed. Sumia was going to take the two Pegasi back into the stables when Cynthia offered to instead as Sumia returned to the castle.

Upon entering, she heard to sets of footsteps. One sounding lighter and faster, the other slower and slightly louder. She turned and saw little Lucina running toward her. "Mom," she squealed happily as her mom picked her up and held her.

"Hey there Lucina. And hi, Lucina," Sumia said turning back to future Lucina, looking a bit older.

"Hello. We were training when she saw you pass by and wanted to say hi." Lucina said.

Sumia smiled and set Lucina down, "Then I guess you should get back to training."

Little Lucina nodded, causing her long blue hair to wave as she ran back with Lucina. Sumia walked farther into the castle into her room and sat down and took a deep breath of relief. She then felt a hand on her shoulder and saw Chrom next to her smiling. "There you are," Chrom said. "I was wondering where you were."

"Oh, I was just helping Cynthia with her riding...Crazy, isn't it? Both of our children seem to be growing so fast." Sumia said, reminiscing over the last few years.

Chrom smiled, "It was bound to happen. But I'm glad it did." He leaned down and kissed Sumia on the cheek as Sumia kissed him back.

Sumia smiled and held Chrom's hand as he sat with her.

What happens next?
111211111222122111111111112111.title: A long time later

1112111112221221111111111121111.content:
Meanwhile, as this all happened, Cordelia lived happily with Stahl and her daughters.

Severa was still as sassy as ever, nowadays doing mercenary work around Ylisse, although she made sure to visit her family, if nothing else just to yell at them for old times sake. Little Severa on the other hand was beginning to show the kind of talent Cordelia herself possessed. She was barely past her 5th birthday, and she was already becoming very experienced with the pegasus Cordelia allowed her to have. She was already developing quite the spear arm, and could throw it pretty far for a kid.

"Wow Severa, that's very good." smiled Cordelia as her daughter landed on the ground, already looking pretty grand in some little armor she made for her.

"Thanks mommy. So when do you think I can join the knights?" she asked eagerly. Cordelia giggled a bit.

"Sweety, that's still a long ways off. I'd say you shouldn't go until your teens at least." she said. That disappointed Severa.

"Why? You said that I'm better than when you were my age." said Severa.

"That's true, and I meant it. But being a pegasus knight for Ylisse is a huge responsibility. For sure, even I wasn't ready until I was 14. Give yourself some time." said Cordelia.

"Okay." said Severa, a little sad at the news.

"Come on, cheer up. How about another run and we'll go see Cynthia and Lucina." she said.

"Yay!" cheered Severa as she got back on her mount.

Cordelia felt prideful, seeing her daughter excel so much. She had this nagging feeling in her head, but brushed it aside. She had for the last few years, but she didn't let it bug her.
1112111112221221111111111121111.title: Cordelia

11121111122212211111111111211111.content:
Sumia was looking over a few displays, and by looking over I mean picking them back up after she knocked the down, when she saw Cordelia and Severa coming. She smiled and walked over and greeted them. "Morning Cordelia. An hello Severa," Sumia said.

Cordelia bowed her head slightly, "Good morning Sumia."

"Hi," Severa chirped as Sumia let out a laugh.

"I'm guessing you wanna see Lucina and Cynthia right? Hold on..." Sumia said as she called their names. Soon, both the children versions and future versions were there.

"Severa!" Cynthia squealed as she hugged Severa.

"So I'm guessing that Severa and Cynthia want to fly together right Cordelia?" Sumia said with a grin.

Cordelia nodded, "I was hoping to have Severa here while I scouted ahead."

Sumia nodded but then said, "I'll come."

This caught Cordelia offguard. "Hm?"

"We don't spend as much time together as usual, so I'll join you if that's alright."

"Of course," Cordelia replied.

Sumia smiled and turned back to her future children. "Could you watch the kids for me?"

"Of course," Lucina said. Sumia smiled and followed Cordelia to the stables as they saddled up and flew off.

What happens next?
11121111122212211111111111211111.title: Trip to the castle

111211111222122111111111112111111.content:
Sumia and Cordelia flew across the plains of Ylisse on their Pegasi as they searched the land. "Oh, I'm still so glad that war is over!" Sumia squealed.

"Yes," Cordelia said, her voice not changing tone. "It is wonderful not having to worry about Grima. I wasn't sure what to do after that until I had Severa. But sadly, Risen still seem to linger."

"Yeah, but there can't be many more, right?" Sumia said hopeful.

"Let's hope not," Cordelia said. They flew along when she spotted an odd looking stone gate with energy swirling about inside. "What's that?"

Sumia saw it and turned to Cordelia. "I'll take a look." Sumia then flew down toward the gate. She came in to fast however and flew off her horse an hit the ground as Cordelia landed nearby. "That'll really bruise..." Sumia grumbled.

Cordelia helped Sumia up as the two looked at the gate, "What is it?"

"I'm not sure," Sumia said. "But it...it feels familiar. Like I've been here before."

"I know what you mean. I feel the same way. What should we do?" Cordelia said.

"Let's go in," Sumia said.

Cordelia seemed a bit surprised. "Really?"

"Yeah. We'll be fine."

Cordelia sighed again an nodded. "Alright, let's go."

The two Pegasus knights then went through.

What happens next?
111211111222122111111111112111111.title: Scouting

1112111112221221111111111121111111.content:
"What is this place?" asked Sumia.

She and Cordelia walked through the gate, entering the swirling mass of energy. Cordelia herself really couldn't figure it out either. It felt like the Outrealm Gates that they had gone through with Chrom's army so long ago, and yet something about it was different.

"I wonder, maybe this goes to some different kind of place. Perhaps not like the ones from years ago." said Cordelia.

"I wonder if we'll be able to get back at this back." said Sumia.

"I'm sure we will. Don't worry too much." said Cordelia, assuring her long-time friend.

Just as she said that, a bright flash of light that often indicated the end of a realm engulfed them, forcing them to cover their eyes as they did. Before long, they passed out from the light.

*****Later on*****

Cordelia felt groggy as she tried to get up from her experience. She could see that she was out in some field, although she felt a lot different than usual. She felt...bigger, it that made sense.

However, a voice interrupted her thoughts.

"Lord Marth!" called a male voice. Somehow, Cordelia turned "his" head and saw a green-haired mage approaching, offering his hand to help Cordelia up.

"There you are sir. I was a bit worried after fighting those Dolhr forces. Everyone seemed to pass out." said the mage.

"Huh?" asked Cordelia, a bit taken back when he looked down at his appearance. You would think that appearing as the legendary Hero-King, Marth, would provoke some large reaction, but Cordelia seemed to have some hidden feelings that thought that it was okay. Despite that, Merric took his hand.

"Come on. Caeda passed out too. Everyone's tiring after all those Manaketes came out of the caves." explained Merric.

Cordelia had zero idea what was going on, but didn't have time to say much before Merric was dragging him away.
1112111112221221111111111121111111.title: New realm

11121111122212211111111111211111111.content:
Caeda felt like she was hit full-force by a Wyvern. She felt herself on the ground with grass under her as her body felt weak. She couldn't remember what happened. She felt something brush past her hand, so she finally pried her eyes open to see Marth above her. "M-Marth! Are you o-" was all Caeda got out before she felt pain rocket through her body when she tried to sit up and fell back down.

"Don't move Caeda," Marth said. Marth took out a few bandages, wrapping one around her forehead and the others on various parts of her body. "Can you stand?"

Caeda answered with a pained face and shaking her head. Marth then put his arms under her shoulders and knees and lifted her up chest height to him. "Let's go."

Caeda was going to protest, but was far too weak to. She curled up in Marth's arms and leaned against his chest. "Th-thanks, Marth..." She felt his hand cradle her head as Marth looked down a gave her a smile. Caeda giving a pained smile back.

"W-where are we g-going?" Caeda asked.

"The castle. We can recover there. I'll let you stay with me until you're better."

Caeda would protest, but instead smiled and leaned against his chest and curled up against him. Marth looked at her a few minutes later and saw her fast asleep.

What happens next?
11121111122212211111111111211111111.title: Meanwhile...

111211111222122111111111112111111111.content:
Marth still had this nagging feeling that Cordelia felt since coming to the realm, although that feeling kept waning as he walked with Caeda. It was an odd sense, like there were stacks of memories all pressed together. It kind of made his head hurt a bit.

"Marth? Are you alright?" asked Merric

"Oh, I'm fine. Just a little headache." said Marth.

"Oh, that's good." said Merric.

Anyway, he walked with them both back with the group they were with, heading back towards Altea castle for now. They needed a rest after the battle with those Dolhr forces. Manaketes made for tough foes.

"I get the feeling that Medeus is getting even bolder as of late. He's sending so many forces at us, so perhaps he feels threatened." said Merric.

"One can hope, although he didn't look the type to be afraid so easily." said Marth.

"Perhaps." smiled Merric. "Anyway, guess you should get yourself and Caeda back. People might get a little restless if you're gone for too long."

"I guess they would." said Marth. With that said, he and the rest made their way back to the castle. Caeda was still asleep in his arms. Slowly, Marth felt his headache get better, which he was thankful for as they finally approached the castle after some time of walking.
111211111222122111111111112111111111.title: The castle

1112111112221221111111111121111111111.content:
Caeda finally woke up. She was laying on a small bed as light shone on her from a nearby window. She felt a bit better since the battle. She sat up, which was a dizzying feat and managed to lumber out of bed to a nearby balcony. She felt the cold, morning wind press against her skin, when she realized she was in a gown of sorts. She looked over the whole Altea as a small smile crept along her face. She then heard the door behind her open and saw Marth in the door.

"Marth! Are you- Woah!" Caeda said before she tripped and began falling down. Luckily, Marth was next to her and caught her before she fell.

"You alright?" Marth asked, helping her stand.

Caeda looked back and nodded. "Yeah. Just lost my balance."

Marth smiled back. "You still seem shaken up. You alright?"

"Of course. I'm ready."

"Good. We have a plan that can get us inside the city to Gharnef. You up for it?"

Caeda stood up straight, "Of course."

Marth smiled. "Good. Your armor is ready. Get it on and meet with us."

Caeda did so and followed Marth out.

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111111121111111111.title: Finally back

11121111122212211111111111211111111111.content:
Caeda got her pegasus knight armor on and grabbed her Wing Spear, ready for this upcoming right. After this little skirmishes with Dolhr, they needed to get to Thabes, the lost city. This city was also where the Dark Pontifex, Gharnef, had set up shop, and Marth eagerly needed to retrieve the Falchion that the dastardly sorcerer had stolen from his family. There was no argument there; he had to be defeated before they got to Medeus.

However, Thabes was very far, as in the corner of the continent far. That being said, they had a saving grace. The white sage, Gotoh, had agreed to use his powerful Warp magic, that could send the army straight to Thabes, an offer that Marth eagerly accepted.

"You ready?" asked Marth.

"As much as I ever will be." said Caeda, gently stroking the mane of her pegasus.

Before long, they felt a large yellow glyph appear underneath the feet of the army, and they were immediately swept away.

*****Thabes*****

Next thing they knew, the army was in Thabes. The city was, as rumored, in ruin. It was but a reminder of what civilization once lived there.

"Lord Gotoh said that Gharnef is in the main tower just ahead." said Merric.

"All right, I guess that's our destination then." said Marth.

Caeda nodded right next to him. "I agree. Let's go."
11121111122212211111111111211111111111.title: Continue

111211111222122111111111112111111111111.content:
The army passed through the ruins of the city. Caeda flew low and ahead of Marth and the others, scouting ahead. She looked around and saw no one in sight, then looked back at the tower looming. She then felt something prickle her neck. She felt that she needed to turn her head. So she did. She saw a glow hidden inside a collapsed temple, obviously built for some deity but was in such ruin that it was unidentifiable. She stared there, something about it was...drawing her to it. She then heard a voice yell out, "Hey!"

She turned and saw Marth below her. She flew down and landed by him and hurried next to him. "No sign of anyone Marth, but...there's something over there." She said pointing over to the temple. "I think we should take a large group and-"

"Let's go." Marth said.

"What?!" Caeda almost yelled.

"If no one's around, the army can hide in the ruins and strike in the morning. And besides, I don't want to worry the soldiers or jeopardize any of them. We'll go together." Marth said, smiling.

Caeda nodded, "Fine." She left her Pegasus outside with army as they settled down. Caeda and Marth then climbed into the ruins.

Caeda and Marth then stood in front of a large stone gate with energy swirling about. "What is it?" Caeda asked.

"Not sure. But...Maybe we should..." Marth said trailing off, but Caeda knew what was happening.

"Are you crazy?! What if we don't make it?" Caeda yelled.

Marth turned and held Caeda by her shoulders, "What if we find help? If anything happens, we'll get through it and return. The men know what to do if I disappear."

Caeda sighed. "Why do I do these crazy things..." She grinned, "Alright, let's go."

The two then walked through.

What happens next?
111211111222122111111111112111111111111.title: Along the way

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
"Ugh, this place makes me kind of wobbly." said Caeda as she struggled to stay on her feet. Marth kept her upright as best as he could.

"I feel strange too. Perhaps it would be best to head back for now." he suggested.

"I agree." said Caeda.

However, before they had a chance to do so, a bright light engulfed both of them, once again signaling the end of another walk through the realms. Before any of them knew it, they were knocked out cold by the light. Marth didn't know what hit him, although he felt something....familiar....go through him, as if he was becoming something he had done before.

*****Land of Nolrem*****
