Katarina had no idea what had happened. She felt as if she couldn't remember what she was doing. She felt aches throughout our body, as the warm rays of the sun coerced her to open her eyes. She could see that she was on the ground, in a soft patch of grass, surrounded by some fields.

"Where.....?" she asked as she struggled to get up, looking over herself. She wore her normal outfit; a light purple short-sleeved top, with dark blue/purple stockings; her typical Sage outfit. However, her head felt like it had been hit with a ton of bricks, and she moved her hand to her head as she sat up.

"Ugh, where am I? How did I get here?" she wondered. Something felt off, like there was something for her to remember, but she couldn't figure out what it was. She looked down at the pockets around her waist, finding a couple of tomes. It was nice to know that she had something to arm herself, even if she had no idea where she was.

Images seemed to flash through her mind; some images looked like her but in a different outfit, others of a red-haired pegasus knight, and others of a blue-haired man. Nothing really made sense. However, she did know one thing; she wasn't supposed to be alone. She knew she had a compaion, but she couldn't remember who and for what reason.

"Maybe if that person is here, then I can ask them what's going on." she told herself as she staggered to her feet, getting over her headache.

*****Katarina (Greg)*****

Gender: Female
Class: Sage
Weapons: Katarina's Bolt, Rexcalibur, Mend, Elixer.
Skills: Tomefaire, Magic +2, Limit Breaker, Tomebreaker, Focus

*****End bio*****
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: Yet another realm

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
Katarina walked along the high grass, still disoriented when she felt her foot hit something. "Oof!" A voice said when Katarina looked down a saw a woman with long green hair in a uniform showing most of her legs.

--------------

Elincia wasn't sure what happened when she came to. She had thoughts of a man with brown hair, a woman with red hair, a Pegasus knight with long silver hair, and a young, blue haired Pegasus knight. She felt weird all over. She didn't know what happened and what was wrong when she awoke.

She also didn't have much time to think when a foot hit her in the gut.

"Are you okay?" A voice shrieked as a hand lifted her from her laying state into a sitting one, she looked up and saw a purple haired girl in purple robes.

"I...th-think.." Elincia said as she stood and smiled slightly. "Where are we?"

"I..." Katarina began, but then stopped. "I'm not sure, but I think I'm gonna find somewhere to rest."

Elincia nodded and was turning when she saw Katarina struggling with walking and almost collapsing. She walked to the girl, who was smaller than her and put a hand in her shoulders. "Come. You can come with me while we try to figure out what happen. I have a house in the city nearby," Elincia said smiling.

Katarina would've been cautious, but was a bit tired and just nodded as the two left.

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: In another place

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
"Excuse me ma'am, but do I know you from somewhere?" asked Katarina. After a good walk, she was beginning to walk better, although she still had a headache. Elincia gave a sincere smile.

"You don't need to be so formal. Anyway, I'm not sure.....but you do seem familiar." said Elincia.

"So you live in this city you talked about?" asked Katarina.

"Yes, I have a house not too far in once we enter the city limits. It's called Aeris, and it's a very nice town. Have you been there before?" asked Elincia. Katarina gave her a confused look.

"No, it doesn't sound familiar. The only city name that I can recall is Guardia." recalled Katarina. Elincia gave a soft giggle that expressed amusement.

"Funny. We both have amnesia, and we ended up in the same field." she said. Katarina laughed a bit more with her on that.

"True, I guess so." she said. "By the way miss, I can see that you're a pegasus knight. Where is your mount?"

"I believe he is at home. At least, I think so." said Elincia. "I guess I hit my head hard too. I'm sure it'll all come back to me. Oh, and there is Aeris."

Finally, the two of them saw the city, right on the edge of the land and overlooking the sea. Katarina thought that it was a beautiful sight.

"Wow, this place is beautiful!" said Katarina.

"I'm glad you like it. My house is a ways inside, so follow me." she said. As they walked in, many people gave signs of respect towards Elincia. Some even bowed.

"Wow, they really like you here. Do you do something for them?" asked Katarina. Elincia wasn't sure.

"I don't know. Maybe I did and I just don't remember." she explained.

Anyway, they finally reached the house after getting through more crowds of people.
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: The city

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
Elincia opened the doors to her home and walked inside with Katarina. The house was nothing too special, but was large and well-stocked. Elincia walked Katarina to a chair and helped her sit as Elincia looked for some water and food. "Thank you so much, er...." Katarina said, not knowing her friend's name.

"Elincia. And don't mention it Katarina," Elincia replied.

Katarina looked up at the sudden sounding of her name. "How'd you know my name?"

"Um...I don't remember...Maybe we should talk about our amnesia," Elincia said as she sat placing food in front of them both. "Or at least what we remember about our amnesia. So Katarina, what do you remember?"

"Not much. I remember a place called Guardia and a few people." Katarina said.

Elincia was silent for a moment and then asked, "These people...What do they look like?"

Katarina leaned back a moment. "One had long red hair and rode a Pegasus like you, another had a regal suit and blue hair, and another was a man that vaguely looked like me and had red hair, and-"

"Wait a minute," Elincia interrupted. "I also remember a man with red hair that reminds me of you. But I also remember another Pegasus rider, but she had sliver hair, a knight with red hair, another Pegasus knight with blue hair, and a paladin with short brown hair."

At that, a thought was triggered in Katarina's mind of a man matching that description. She held her head as Elincia knelt by her side, "You okay?"

"I...just remembered the man you described."

Elincia nodded, "Let's rest. Here." Elincia then left and returned with a nightgown for Katarina. "Here, wear this. We'll rest and then figure out what to do next." Katarina nodded as the two changed and clothes and went to sleep.

---The next day---

Elincia woke up and nudged Katarina awake, who woke with a groan. Elincia smiled, "Wake up sleepyhead." Katarina and Elincia changed and then stood fully dressed. "So, where should we start?" Elincia asked Katarina.

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: Elincia's house

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
"Wasn't there a gate in those fields we appeared in?" asked Katarina.

"Now that I think about it, I believe there was." said Elincia. "You think it's significant?"

"Maybe it's related to our amnesia. I'd like to to at least take a look at it." said Katarina. Just as she said that, her stomach grumbled, making her blush a bit.

"But I guess we should have breakfast first." smiled Elincia, which made Katarina giggle a little bit. With that decided, the two of them helped themselves to a little breakfast Elincia made in the kitchen. Thankfully, she was a pretty good cook. It didn't take too long for them to enjoy a nice breakfast and ready themselves for flying out to the gate. This time, Elincia had her pegasus all ready to go, so they wouldn't need to walk like before.

So, once they washed up and ate, they were on Elincia's pegasus, flying over the city and heading towards the field where they first showed up.

"I wish I could have at least saw Guardia though. I wanted to know what it was about." said Katarina.

"Don't worry. We'll try to come back once we're done. Then, we can see your home." said Elincia with a reassuring smile.

"Thanks." said Katarina.

After she said that, they soon flew over the fields where they first showed up. Elincia had her pegasus fly back on its own after they landed, as she didn't want anything bad to happen to it while they looked around.

"There it is." said Katarina, arriving at the gate. Elincia came up to it and felt uneasy.

"I'm not sure about this. I feel like I've gone though this before. Too many times actually." she said.

"I feel the same way, but I have to know what it is." said Katarina as she grabbed Elincia's hand. "Don't worry, we'll stick together while we're inside."

"Thank you." smiled Elincia.

With that, the two of them took a couple of careful steps, entering the swirling mass of energy.
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: Head to the Gate

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
The two passed through the gate and walked through the Outrealm. As they moved, Katarina saw something. And by saw something, I mean had a flashback. She grabbed her head as an image appeared in her head and a name echoed in her ears. "Katarina? What's wrong?" Elincia asked as she kneeled next to her.

"I saw that boy...Jacob..." Katarina said exhausted.

"Jacob? Who-?" Before Elincia could finish, she saw a wall of light slam into them.

----------

Jacob felt cold. His body felt...wrong in every aspect. He could feel he was laying in his face in what felt like grass. Jacob pried his eyes opened to see he was laying on his face. What...happened?

He pushed himself onto his hands and knees as he craned his neck and looked up to see they were in a field with a dirt road nearby. He then turned and saw something else in the field of grass.

Greg!

Jacob stood and took a single step before falling again, weaker than he was seconds ago. Jacob coughed up whatever he ate last and fell down again. He then realized he was in a few odd looking robes. Jacob coughed and laid there hoping to get help.

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: Traveling again

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
Once again, Greg felt achy as he tried to wake up. He had no idea what just happened. He felt like he had just gone a long time without thinking. It didn't feel like just a few days, but rather years since he felt like this.

"What happened?" he asked himself as he tried to sit up. He struggled to look up, trying to look himself over. He could see that his clothing was radically different from the Dread Fighter he was before. It was dark blue still, but it looked like...a Lord outfit.

"Why am I wearing this? What have I been doing?" he asked himself.

Further looking himself over, he could see another odd thing. He looked.... a bit smaller. Not to much that it wasn't manly or anything, but definitely noticeable. The top had short sleeves, and he had some gloves on his hands, and his pants and boots looked typical enough, although perhaps a tiny bit weird for a guy.

Not only that, Greg could feel something brush against his neck. He reached back and saw that his red hair was a little darker, as well as being a bit longer, a little bit past his ears at least. It was all so confusing for him.

But then, he saw Jacob lying down.

"Jacob, is that you? What are you doing lying there?" he asked.

"Just help me up." said Jacob, a bit frustrated.

"Well, okay." said Greg, offering his hand and pulling Jacob up.
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: Greg awakes

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
Jacob held his hand up as Greg grabbed it and lifted Jacob up into him as Jacob leaned against him. "Greg...why are you...where..?" Jacob said disoriented from standing.

"I'm not sure, but it looks like we were both effected." Greg said. Jacob looked at himself and saw he seemed much smaller and his body had a different figure. Jacob looked down and saw an odd set of Trickster armor adorned on him. Jacob walked around a little bit.

"Why are you in Lord's armor? And why am I smalle-Woah!" Jacob said before he fell on nothing and face-planted. "...And can't walk..."

Greg helped him up, but something else caught his eye. The landscape.

It was Nadion.

Greg remembered this place. Jacob injured himself and fell of his horse as Greg retreated and they ran. Greg helped Jacob up and told him. "It's Nadion. Is...is the war over?"

"Maybe...but...what happened to us?" Jacob said.

"We'll figure out tomorrow. Let's follow the road and find a place to rest."

---Jacob---

Class: Trickster

Weapons: Silver Sword, Killing Edge.

Skills: Locktouch, Movement +1, Limit Breaker, Acrobat, Lethality.

------------

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: What happened over the years

choices: Back to work in the morning
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
After a while, Greg and Jacob wondered into a town. Greg vaguely remembered the town, being one of few he actually got to see while he was here. Of course, he imagined people might not recognize him the way he was right now. He wondered how long this new form would last.

He saw signs of reconstruction around, and wondered how long the war had gone on. He decided to ask a random passer-by.

"Excuse me sir, but we've come here from a bit out of town. I heard there was a war here once." said Greg. The man didn't seem fazed by the statement.

"There was. Started about 5 years ago or so. However, a few months ago, those warriors just went up and vanished." said the man, who walked away. Greg pondered the man's words as they found themselves an inn and sat down in their rooms not too long after. Jacob felt light-headed from it all.

"Did he really say 5 years? Has that much time pasted?" asked Jacob.

"I guess so. I can't seem to remember much from these past years, except that I have this feeling that I had a family of some sorts." said Greg.

"Weird, so did I. I remember being a part of royalty or something." said Jacob.

"That must have been fun." smiled Greg.

"Maybe." said Jacob. "So now what? The war seems to be elsewhere, according to that man."

"I hope my family back in Kiradia is still doing fine. If 5 years really has gone by. Then again, since we first went through that weird gate, I feel like we're not the same." said Greg.

"Tell me about it. I mean, your whole physique is different, and the hair almost makes you look like a girl." said Jacob.

"Speak for yourself." muttered Greg.

Anyway, the conversation went on for a while until they finally retired for bed. They had a slight embarrassment problem though when one of the inn maids mistook Greg for a girl and supplied them with a nightgown, probably because of the smaller build and physique. Needless to say, they immediately put it out of their minds.
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: They rest

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
Jacob sat up groggily in his bed, placing a hand to his head. He felt as if he'd been hit upside the head with a javelin. Jacob then looked at his body. He wore clothing similar to that of the merchant, Anna. Same colors and everything. She then saw his body was contoured differently. His legs seemed more shapely but smaller, his arms thinner and his overall body size and muscle mass decreased.

Jacob got up and moved toward the restroom silently, hoping not to wake Greg up...sadly though, Jacob tripped, landed with a thud and woke Greg. Greg sat up and looked at Jacob on the ground. "You alright there?"

Jacob just gave a thumbs up, not even attempting to get up now. Greg chuckled lightly and then stood and stretched his new limbs. "Alright. It's time to figure out what happened when he left."

Jacob picked himself up off the ground and turned to Greg. "Right," he replied.

The two suited up and left for the gate again. A few moments later they stood at the gate of that realm. "I don't know about this," Jacob said, being very wary of the situation at hand.

"I don't like it either, but maybe there are answers here."

"Maybe...Let's just get this over with."

The two then walked through the gate, yet again.
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: Back to work in the morning

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
"Ugh, I still feel woozy." moaned Jacob.

The two of them were walking through the gate, with Greg helping Jacob stay up a little. Jacob's headache still hadn't fully subsided after their little episode after so long. Greg was a bit worried for how things had turned out.

"Strange. Hard to believe 5 years really passed." said Greg. "I hope my family still thinks I'm alive."

"I'm sure they do. I imagine they figured that any exploration of yours would take a while to do." said Jacob.

"True. But I haven't written them or at least seen them for a day." said Greg.

"Well, my gut feeling is that they know you're alive and well." said Jacob. "Although my gut doesn't feel too good though."

"Just take it easy. We haven't been ourselves in so long. You probably just got a bit of shock." said Greg. He then added, "Perhaps we should pick up some medicine when we reach the next realm."

"Good idea. Let's hope the Einherjar didn't go there next though." said Jacob.

"True enough." said Greg.

The two of them continued to walk, although Jacob noticed that it was taking a long time to reach the next realm.

"Funny. Have all the walks between realms been this long?" he asked.

"Maybe some roads are longer than others. I guess we'll turn back if we don't see anything." said Greg.

Right as he said that though, a bright light appeared in front of them. They nodded to each other and walked forward, shielding their eyes as they reached a new realm. Well, sort of.
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: The new realm

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
Greg shielded his eyes from the ongoing light, as he really didn't want to pass out yet again. This whole passing out when going to a new world thing was really getting old fast. The walk through the light seemed to last forever, and Greg even lost sight of Jacob, thanks to how bright it was. As he walked a little further, the light got more intense, and Greg stumbled through it, closing his eyes as he landed face-first downward.

*****Ylisse*****

Gabrielle slowly opened her eyes, seeing that she was face-first in the ground. She felt like she had a major headache, bringing her gloved hand to her forehead.

"Ugh, what hit me?" she said as she struggled to get up on her feet. Before she could however, she heard a voice.

"Lady Gabrielle!" she heard the girl call out. Gabrielle followed the voice, seeing a brown-haired girl running towards her. She had long brown hair, most of it underneath a white garment on her head. She wore a brown dress that went down to the knees, with a white top covering her assets, as the dress didn't cover that area. She wore brown boots to complete the look. Gabrielle noticed a worried look on the girls' face, feeling that something was off. However, that feeling went away as Gabrielle smiled when the girl approached.

"Lady Gabrielle, what are you doing out here?! Are you hurt?!" asked the girl, extending her hand. Gabrielle giggled and allowed herself to be helped up. As she did, she tucked a bit of her long red hair behind her ears. She then looked at her attire, a purple lord outfit, and dusted off some of the dirt. She didn't want it to stay dirty after all.

"I'm just fine, Julia. Don't worry." smiled Gabrielle. "And you know that you don't have to call me Lady." she added.

"My apologies, but you are my lord." said Julia, making Gabrielle sigh.

"And you've been my friend since before that even mattered. So let's not speak of it anymore." smiled Gabrielle. She then put a hand to her head, trying to remember what she was doing.

"Julia, what was I doing here again?" she asked. Julia sighed.

"You are in Ylisse, as requested by Lord Chrom. I believe he said that he had something to thank you with your assistance in the Grima war." Julia explained. Just as she said it, Gabrielle's eyes lit up in understanding, as the memories came back to her.

"Ah yes, now I remember. Thanks Julia." said Gabrielle before lowering her eyes. "Wait, these are the plains east of Ylisstol."

"Of course. The farm I live at now is around here." smiled Julia. Gabrielle nodded again.

"Oh that's right. After the war, you married that country kid. Donnel was it?" she asked, getting a nod from Julia.

"Well, I guess I can spare a visit for my oldest friend. Although, I would hate to leave Caerleon unattended to for long." said Gabrielle.

"Sigh, you're as persistent as ever when it comes to Caerleon." smiled Julia while shaking her head. Gabrielle gave her a small tap on her shoulder.

"Hey, you were born there too, so it's not just me." smiled Gabrielle, making the two young women laugh.

"Well, I can show you my village before you go to Ylisstol." said Julia.

"Sounds like a plan." said Gabrielle as the two began to walk.
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: Same world, new place

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
Julia walked through her village alongside Gabrielle. The town was fairly small with only a few huts and farms. A few villagers stopped and turned to look at Gabrielle, a few even bowing.

"The village seems to be doing well, Julia," Gabrielle said as they continued walking.

"Things got better after Grima was finally settled with. Things are still tough out here, but we do our best to make it by. Come on, I'll show you my home." Julia said with a smile.

Soon enough, on the outskirts of town was Julia's home. There were fields all around, either it had crops growing or it had animals grazing. The house was small with a hay roof, but it worked. "Here it is. I know it's not much, but..." Julia began.

"It's lovely," Gabrielle stated. "You seem to be doing well. I'm glad."

"Oh. I bet Donnel would like to meet you. Come on!"

Julia went back around the house and, to both of their surprise, Donnel was stabbing bails of hay for no reason, holding a pitchfork like a spear. "Donnel?"

Donnel turned and blushed for a moment, looking embarrassed. "O-Oh shoot! Hey ther' Julia!"

"What are you doing Donnel?" Julia asked.

Donnel leaned the pitchfork against the shed and walked towards them. "I thought it nice 'fer me to 'git a bit of training in."

Julia smiled. "Always getting stronger..." Julia kissed Donnel on the cheek as he blushed again. "Donnel, I want you to meet my friend Gabrielle."

At that, Donnel's pot that was on his head fell off in shock as he caught and turned red. "Ya mean the one from Caerleon? Oh shoot! Yer' majesty!...er Ma'am!"

Gabrielle chuckled. "Calm down Donnel! You don't need to be so formal."

Donnel sighed one of relief and turned to Julia. "So, is she staying with is fer now 'er...?"

"Oh no. We need to meet Chrom back at Ylisstol."

"Alright. Guess I'll see ya later, sweetpea!" Donnel said giving Julia a kiss. Gabrielle and Julia turned and walked away.

"Seems like he's quite the charmer," Gabrielle said with a smirk.

Julia turned red in an instant. "G-Gabrielle!"

Gabrielle laughed as they soon arrived in Ylisstol.

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: The farming village

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
"Lady Gabrielle? Lady Gabrielle!"

Gabrielle (Greg) opened her eyes slowly and sat up. She felt like she fell out of the sky. She held a hand to her head and pushe her red hair out of her face. She tried to stand but then fell back, only to be caught by a another woman. Her hair was brown with a white garment over her hair. She wore a dress that reached her knees and stopped below her assets, which were covered in a white top. "Are you alright, Milady?" The woman answered.

"Y-yes...Thank you, Julia." Gabrielle turned and smiled as Julia (Jacob) helped her up.

"Of course, Milady."

Gabrielle chuckled. "Julia, we've known each other since childhood. You can call me Gabrielle."

Julia nodded then smiled warmly. "Thanks mi-..Gabrielle. Now I'll get you back to my farm."

Gabrielle nodded. Julia was always a good friend to her, but she felt as though something was off. She shrugged as Julia helped her to her home.

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: Somewhere else

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
Hey Greg, do you feel woozy? Because I do." moaned Jacob.

The two of them were walking through the gate, with Greg helping Jacob stay up a little. Jacob's headache still hadn't fully subsided after their little episode after so long. Greg was a bit worried for how things had turned out.

"A little bit. It is a little hard to take in after all, with the whole 5 years thing." said Greg. "I hope my family still thinks I'm alive."

"I'm sure they do. I imagine they figured that any exploration of yours would take a while to do." said Jacob.

"True. But I haven't written them or at least seen them for a day." said Greg.

"I think you'll be fine." said Jacob. "We'll figure more out as we go along."

"Heh, you have a point." said Greg. He then added, "Perhaps we should pick up some medicine when we reach the next realm."

"Good idea. Let's hope the Einherjar didn't go there next though." said Jacob.

"True enough." said Greg.

The two of them continued to walk, although Jacob noticed that it was taking a long time to reach the next realm.

"Funny. Have all the walks between realms been this long?" he asked.

"Maybe some roads are longer than others. I guess we'll turn back if we don't see anything." said Greg.

Right as he said that though, a bright light appeared in front of them. They nodded to each other and walked forward, shielding their eyes as they reached a new realm. Well, sort of. This one was starting to look considerably bleaker.
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: Something new, perhaps....

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
Noire woke up as the musty, smoke-filled air filled her nostrils. She sat up on the stone-tiled floor of the castle in Ylisstol.
She remembered when they came here as a last resort against Grima. They had Gules, one of the stones of the Fire Emblem, but today they had to look for Argent.

Noire dusted her green archers gear off and stood up. The others must've waken up already. Noire found her bow as she held it against her chest sheepishly. She was ready to go when she remembered, "W-wait!...My talisman!"

She hurried back and grabbed it. She remembered her mother giving this to her. She misses her. Noire held the Talisman close and stood.

She started toward the throne room when she heard something. She turned around and held her bow, shaking nervously. "Who's there?"

Soon, a girl with two red pigtails and a Mercenary outfit came out with a Steel sword. "Noire! Where in blazes have you been?" Severa asked.

"Severa! D-Don't scare me like that!"

"Gawds....Anyway, come on. Lucina already paired us into groups, let's go already!"

"Oh...s-sorry."

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: The Future Past

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
"So....where are we going?" asked Noire. Severa sighed and turned around.

"For crying out loud, weren't you listening?!" Severa nearly yelled.

"Ah!! Don't yell!" replied Noire. Severa shook her head and put a hand to her head.

"Gawds, this is annoying. Fine, listen up this time." said Severa, giving Noire her trademark glare. "We only have Gules so far, and we're splitting up to find the others, as well as the Fire Emblem itself. You, me, Kjelle, and Nah are heading deep into Plegia, where we believe Azure will be."

"A-And the others?" asked Noire.

"Owain and some of the other guys are going to go look for Argent and Sable. Cynthia, Laurent, and Gerome are going to look for Vert and the Fire Emblem." explained Severa, sighing. "There, understand now?" she said, putting her hands on her hips.

"Y-Yes, I got it! Thanks." smiled Noire.

"Whatever. Anyway, let's go. Kjelle and Nah are waiting just outside the castle gate. I'd rather get there before the Risen do." said Severa, turning around and walking down the stairs.

"Wait for me!" cried Noire as she tried to keep up with the mercenary. Not really paying attention, Severa kept walking down until they reached the ground floor, heading out towards the gate. Once there, she could see a dark-haired girl wearing heavy armor, and a light green-haired girl who carried a little stone with her. The armored girl scowled a bit as she got off the ground after doing some sit-ups.

"Glad to see that you finally made it." said Kjelle.

"Well, Noire apparently overslept. Gawds." groaned Severa.

"I said I was sorry!" cried Noire.

"Well, we're all here now and that's good enough. So, shall we be going?" suggested Nah, as calm and cool as ever.

"Sure. The sooner we find Azure, the better." said Severa. With that, the group of four began walking, although Severa and Noire couldn't help but feel something odd about them. However, they just shook it off.

"So, how strong do you think the Risen will be? We'll be going pretty deep into Plegia after all." said Severa.

"They shouldn't be too bad. I'm here after all." smiled Kjelle with confidence.

"If anyone can hoard off a bunch of Risen, it's Kjelle." giggled Nah with a slight teasing tone. Kjelle gave her a deadpan look. Noire giggled lightly at the conversation.
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: The group

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
The land before them that was once Plegia was now a scorched and burning wasteland. Smoke covered the air as the four passed through, looking for what Azure. It wasn't long until they found what seemed to be an abandoned Plegian fort. "I have a feeling Azure could be in there," Nah said, motioning towards the fortress.

"R-really...?" Stammered Noire as she shook at the mere-sight of the fort.

Severa sighed, "Gawds Noire, are you coming or not?"

"W-wait for me!"

The fort was quite ominous, with smoke in every corridor and an eerie quietness over them. Noire walked forward behind Kjelle, holding her bow awkwardly against her chest. They reached what they believed was the center of the fort to see an empty pedestal. "Was it here before, you think?" Kjelle asked.

"Possibly," Nah replied. Then something moved in the bushes nearby as a Risen in Thief cloaks ran out, Noire though, had her talisman out and was already nocking an arrow.

"BLOOD AND THUNDER!" Noire yelled as the arrow launched and took the Risen down, as a small orb rolled from it's fading corpse.

"There! Azure!" Severa said as she ran over and picked it up. "Now we just have to get to Lucina and the others."

Noire nodded sheepishly, Nah smiled, and Kjelle nodded with a slight grin as Severa slid Azure into her pouch.

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: Deep into Plegia

choices: In a nearby forest of Ylisse
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content: Where may they be?
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: Somewhere new

1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.content:
It wasn't long before the two soon lost consciousness and collapsed in the realms.

-----------

Jacob opened her eyes to see green grass by her face. It was becoming to common and easy to tell if they were female. Jacob quickly put herself into a standing position. She was shocked by quite a few things, first being the fact all the armor she had on. It was made up of large metal plates of great thickness. Second, was how easily she could stand while wearing the armor. It felt like air.

Jacob soon looked in a nearby pond in the area nearby at herself. She was a young girl with short brown hair reaching below her chin and with firm facial features. She looked through her inventory to see a Silver Lance and Silver Axe. She soon looked around and saw another girl nearby, however it was quite obvious to be Greg.

Greg was in the armor of that of a Pegasus rider. She also had two blue pigtails hanging off her head. She seemed perky and happy already as she woke up and stretched, a Silver Lance and Cure staff at her side. The two looked at one another. "Again huh?"

"Yep."

Greg stood. "Well, we know the drill. Let's go see where and who we are."

What happens next?
1112111112221221111111111121111111111111.title: In a nearby forest of Ylisse

113.content:
Greg walked through the streets of a town he came across in the Outrealm. He very much enjoyed it due to it's peaceful atmosphere. He passed by a few vendors and grabbed something to eat.

It had been a few days since he left Kirada. He kept thinking of his family, and his little sister Karen. He felt that something was out there, so he left and was still exploring.

He walked through the city when he saw something on the roof of one of the buildings. A man in black and brown garbs climbed onto the roof and looked around. Greg watched the man jump from roof to roof running somewhere. Greg quickly followed the man, intrigued by his actions. Greg watched the man stop on a roof before dropping inside. Greg continued his pursuit and looked for a way in.

What happens next?
113.title: One ordinary day

1131.content:
Name: Jacob

Age: 15 (Almost 16)

Gender: Male

Height and weight: 5'11, 146 lbs.

Class: Thief, with black and brown garbs and a hood.

Personality: Laid back, honest, kind (surprisingly).

Bio: Jacob has been a shadowy thief for sometime. His intentions though are known only to him as he steals from people of all calibers. He recently heard of some structure locked inside a building. And after some heisting, he has the key and works to get there.

This is Jacob.

--------------

Jacob opened the hatch and dropped through the roof. He looked around before seeing a large stone gate glowing eerily. "Well well well," Jacob said. "This looks nice." Before he could do anything else. He heard a door open. Someone is inside.

What happens next?
1131.title: The thief

11311.content:
"What are you doing here?" asked Greg as he entered the room.

"Rats, thought I was more discrete than that. Oh well." shrugged Jacob. Greg narrowed his eyes at Jacob.

"I'll ask again. Who are you and what are you doing here?" asked Greg. Jacob shrugged again.

"The name's Jacob. Pleasure to meet you." said Jacob as he came out and left his hand out for a handshake. Greg was a bit hesitant at first but took the handshake.

"Are you a thief?" asked Greg.

"Correct. I'd say that was obvious enough." smirked Jacob. Greg sighed. This guy seemed a bit too laid-back for his taste. Heck, for a thief in general.

"I guess while I'm asking, what are your intentions here?" he asked.

"Oh just looking around, seeing what I can find. You never know what you'll find in the oddest of places." said Jacob.

"You're awfully carefree for someone who steals from people." said Greg.

"We all have to make a living somehow, right?" smirked Jacob before turning his attention back over to the stone gate in the room. "Hey, what do you think that gate' about? Not something I've ever seen." he added. Greg looked over at said gate.

"It kind of looks like an Outrealm Gate, but not like one I've ever seen before, and I've seen a few." said Greg.

"You an explorer?" asked Jacob.

"Pretty much. Been one for a couple of months or so." said Greg.

"Well, this should be up your alley then. A mysterious gate is perfect for an explorer, right?" asked Jacob with a smirk.

"You gone through one?" asked Greg.

"Heck no. But I'm curious. Let's take a peek, shall we?" suggested Jacob, walking up to the front of the gate. Greg was hesitant, but he was an explorer. He didn't want to leave any possibility unturned.

"Well, I guess so." said Greg, walking up to him.

"Great, come on." said Jacob, grabbing his hand and pulling them both through.
11311.title: Friendly introduction

113111.content:
Moments later, they were surrounded by swirling energy and color walking ahead. "Wow..." Jacob said taking the sight in. "This is inside that little gate. Quite shocking isn't it Greg?...Greg?" He turned and saw Greg get...hazy? Maybe that was just Jacob since he collapsed along with him a moment later.

---------

Jacob woke up in tall grass. His body felt all...weird. He felt something on his chest pushing down and felt as if there was more weight in his legs. He held a hand to his head and groaned. "Ugh...What just-?" Jacob stopped. He thought someone just a spoke, maybe a woman. He sat up and saw something he didn't expect to see. He saw two new assets hang from "her" chest and two long and fit legs. He saw blonde hair hang from her peripheral vision. "What happened?" Jacob spoke in her voice. He then saw a woman with pink hair sit up next to her.

"What....what happened?" The woman said.

Jacob looked over, "Alright listen lady, I'm just looking for my friend Greg, alright?"

"Greg...I'm...Greg. Where's Jacob?" Greg asked.

Jacob sighed. "Great. The freakin Outrealm turned us into chicks!" Jacob said.

Greg saw herself and sighed, frustrated. "Great. I guess we're stuck like this until we figure out something."

Jacob stood and realized that her body was in shape. Almost like the person he became was a thief already. He picked the woman up and saw her as a Myrmidon with not much covering her legs.

What happens next?
113111.title: Through the gate

1131111.content:
Greg stumbled slightly on her feet, getting used to the slight heels on her feet. She looked down her hands; gloved but smaller and nimbler than what she was used to. She looked down her body; a lithe and lean frame, although with a bit of muscle. Her black top covered her ample breasts snugly, and her short skirt revealed much of her lean legs, which were smooth yet strong. Her arms were much the same, lean but strong, as if a blade felt so natural in her hands. She put a hand to her head, feeling long light purple hair, most of it in a ponytail. It did a good job of keeping it out of her face.

She looked over at who she assumed was Jacob. Her new form looked considerably older, and like a thief as he used to be. She had long blonde hair, and was quite taller than Greg was. Greg could swear that she had seen that look somewhere before but where?

Wait, that wasn't important. She was furious right now. She walked right up and grabbed Jacob.

"Nice going genius! Your bright idea not only put us in the middle of nowhere, but now I'm a girl!" said Greg.

"Well, if it's any consolation, you're a good-looking girl." said Jacob.

"That's not the point. Ugh, I left home to explore new worlds, and now I've become a girl." she groaned. Putting a hand on her hip, Greg groaned. This was not the best day for her.

"Look, I'm sorry about that. We'll try and fix this, alright?" suggested Jacob. Greg looked at Jacob and sighed, calming down a bit.

"Alright. Sorry for flipping out on you." said Greg.

"No problem. I'm a bit surprised I didn't flip out as well. At least you got a good look. You look just like Marisa." said Jacob. That surprised Greg. She didn't think of that.

"The Crimson Flash? From the Magvelian legends?" she asked.

"The very one. Go take a look in that stream if you need proof." said Jacob, pointing to the nearby stream. Greg ran over and looked at herself in the reflection, seeing her smooth face, with eyes that matched her hair.

"I am Marisa. Unbelievable." said Greg. With that, she turned to Jacob.

"Well, if I became a past warrior, I guess you did too. But I don't recognize yours." said Greg.

"Neither do I, but oh well. Let's see if we can find a town somewhere." said Jacob.

"Sure." sighed Greg.

With that, the two of them began a walk down the plains, hoping to run into some kind of town.
1131111.title: Explore

11311111.content:
Jacob walked alongside Marisa, well, actually Greg. She was still trying to wrap her head around everything that's happened.

Jacob's body felt odd as she walked in it. Her body had different proportions in comparison to her original body. It felt awkward walking in this new body, 'How am I suppose to do any stealing if I can barely walk?' Jacob thought to herself, even her mental voice being a female.

"Hey, where you from Greg?" Jacob said, hoping to make some form of conversation.

Greg sighed but said, "A small village in the Outrealms. Kirada."

"That actually sounds familiar. Maybe my services were used there.....Oh, um...?" Jacob said regretting his last statement.

Greg chuckled, "Nah, we don't have thieves."

Jacob sighed in relief, "Alright."

Greg asked back however, "Where are you from?"

Jacob shrugged, "I move from place to place, but spend most of it in the city we were just at."

Jacob looked over their weapons and saw she had a knife and a killing edge. "Hey Greg, what weapons do you have?" Jacob asked curious if both of their weapons changed.

Greg looked and saw she had a killing edge upgraded and a silver sword.

What happens next?
11311111.title: The walk through the plains

113111111.content:
As the changed Greg and Jacob kept walking along, Jacob finally noticed something.

"Ah, finally a village!" she said.

"Oh good." said Greg, happy to find some civilization somewhere. To be honest, she was feeling a bit self-conscious in the short skirt, although a part of her didn't mind it. However, she didn't get much time to think about it, as she saw Jacob already heading towards the village. Greg sighed and ran up to catch up with her. Soon enough, they reached the village, which seemed to be rather ordinary from the looks of it.

"Well, at least it looks good enough to sleep in for a night. What do you think?" asked Greg. However, when she turned away, Jacob wasn't there. Greg turned behind him and saw Jacob sneaking around, making her shake her head.

"Ugh, what a waste of time." she sighed as she starting trying to find an inn. I mean, if felt nice being this warrior that he only heard of in legends, but this was going a bit too far. Anyway, Greg looked around until she finally found an inn off to the side.

"Finally." she sighed as she immediately entered the inn. She walked up to the registration and got a room for both her and Jacob. The lady at the desk happily gave her a set of keys. Greg said thanks and promptly left, deciding to tour around while Jacob did who knows what. Sighing again, Greg again walked outside. However, as he did, she honestly didn't feel like being around all these people. She briefly out her left hand on her sword.

"I can't concentrate with all these people. I could use some privacy." she said, not really aware of what she said. She went out behind the inn, finding an alleyway that no one was walking through.

"Perfect." said Greg as she drew her sword with her left hand, beginning to take some sword strikes. She had a reputation to uphold after all. A memory of her father flashed through, one of many where he had placed blunt swords at her sides to prevent her from rolling over in her sleep.
113111111.title: They find a town

1131111111.content:
Heather (Jacob) walked through the street eating something she plucked from a vendor without being seen. She stopped when she saw a vendor passing through town. He seemed to have expensive looking jewelry. She dropped down and snuck up behind him. "Well hey there," she said with a hand on her hip.

The man turned around surprised, "Oh! I didn't see you there. You thinking of buying anything here? Maybe this necklace, perhaps?" The man said, hoping she would buy it. That wasn't happening.

"Oh, well I was wondering if you were still on the market?" Heather walked closer until she was standing right in front of the vendor. "So are you?"

"U-um...." The vendor stammered, obviously shocked an blushing. Little did he know that she was stealing half of his merchandise.

"Tell you what. I'll come back later and check...see ya later, sweetie." Heather then turned and walked into an alley. She then pulled her new accessories out. She smiled, but knew she couldn't use a lot since a bit of it was for her mother.

Hey? Where was that other girl she came with? Oh, she went to the inn. Maybe I should head there. Heather then made her way to the inn.

What happens next?
1131111111.title: Later on

12.content:
*****Greg*****

Age: 20
Appearance: 5'10 feet tall, and 150 lbs. Short red hair and blue eyes. Rather average build. Wears typical Mercenary garb with blue colors.
Personality: Shy, but friendly and helpful.
Origin: In a village named Kirada in the Outrealms. Kirada is a quaint little town surrounded by plains and hills, with the ocean some distance away. Large mountains loom in the distance.
Race: Human
Class: Mercenary (Level 15)
Uses: Swords (Level A),
Asset and Weakness: Speed and Luck
Equipment: Zenith (forged brave sword), Steel Sword, and an Elixir.

*****End*****

The last thing Greg really wanted was to be stuck in traffic in a market place. However, that was exactly where he was now. You see, Greg had just left his home or Kirada, leaving via the Outrealm Gate that laid outside his home village. This was all out of some sense of adventure, hoping to see what was beyond the city. He also hoped to hone his old skills so he could be useful in the future.

Still, with what little gold he had, he was paying for some supplies. He thankfully had the capacity to keep his items in check. Karen, his cousin, would probably chastise him if he was unorganized. His cousin was a pretty strong healer, in the War Cleric class. He knew that he couldn't cross her, even more than his own mother. Well anyway, at least he didn't have to worry about her in another realm.

With the sun still low in the sky after staying the night, Greg was just getting his vulneraries and other such items in check when he happened to see someone bump into him. The two ended up falling to the ground, though Greg thankfully held on to his items.

"Who are you?" asked Greg to the mysterious stranger.
12.title: Character #2

122.content:
****Jacob****

Age: 16
Gender: Male
Class: Dark Knight (w/o horse)
Personality: Easy-going, adventurous.
Level: 9
Weapons: Silver Sword, Thoron, Goetia.
Skills: Aggressor, Vengeance, Shadowgift, Strength +5, Resistance +10.
Background: A Knight in self-training, wants to see more of the world outside of this realm.
Appearance: Standard Silver and dark purple Dark Knight armor.

****End****

Wham!

Jacob collapsed next to the boy he slammed into, knocking off his helmet. He quickly retrieved it and looked forward. He saw a boy in a blue mercenary garb with short red hair, and no older then him. He was soon interested in the boy a little.

He had seen him before, in a few different towns. Him continuously seeing this boy made him wonder what he was doing. Jacob stood himself up and reached a hand out to the vulnerary-clutching boy. "Sorry. Need help?"

The boy accepted and pulled himself up. "Thanks. Sorry about that."

Jacob shrugged. "It's fine. Say, mind me asking what you're doing?"

The boy shrugged and explained how he left his town to come here and explore. Jacob respected the fact that he could do that. And soon, Jacob felt in the mood to try it out as well. "Would you mind if I tagged along? You could use some help getting around and I have all the time in the world..."

What does Greg answer with?
122.title: Meeting someone

1221.content:
"Why the sudden interest? You don't even know my name." Greg spoke, finding a little odd that this random guy has just offered his assistance.

"Well....I'm kind of a knight in self-training so to speak, and I've seen you around the neighboring villages." Jacob spoke with a sheepish laugh. Greg squinted his eyes at him.

"So you've been stalking me?" Greg accused, causing Jacob to rapidly flail his arms about.

"W-What?! N-No no! Nothing like that! It's just that......"

"Just that what?" Greg asked, crossing his arms.

"Just that.....you look like a foreigner. No offense, but I can tell that you're not from this land. So...." Jacob scratched the back of his head, since Greg didn't look convinced. Still, Greg was curious, and despite not fully trusting him yet, had a thought.

"Let's sit down over lunch for a bit. I could use a break anyway." said Greg.

"Sounds good to me."

With that, Greg moved them over to a nice area of the village, finding themselves a good spot to have a little lunch. Greg was pretty adept at this point of making lunches on the go. Thankfully, so was Jacob.

"By the way, you never even told me your name." spoke Greg as he took a bit of his sandwich. Jacob's face went a little red with embarrassment.

"Heh...guess I forgot....I'm Jacob. I'm from the main capital of this land, traveling about for experience." Jacob explained.

Greg nodded in understanding. "Pleasure then. I'm Greg, and I'm from Kirada."

"Kirada? Hmm, definitely not in this land." spoke Jacob.

"Well no, I came through an Outrealm Gate." said Greg.

"Oh, I've heard of those. Never been through one myself though." said Jacob.

"I've only been through it once, coming from Kirada to this land." said Greg. "I actually haven't been traveling for very long. Only a couple of weeks or so."

"Interesting." said Jacob. He paused for a bit as he finished his own meal. "Well, I can say for sure that you're a man who knows what he's doing, and frankly, I could go anywhere right now. Guess that adventurous vibe of yours stood out."

"You don't say. Well, I will admit that it's been a bit boring by myself. I guess you can tag along." said Greg as he got up. "Though, the minute you begin to feel like dead weight, you're on your own."

"Oh, is that how it is?" smiled Jacob. "Well, we'll see who ends up dead weight partner."

Greg just smirked as he accepted the dark knight's handshake. As he didn't want to waste too much time, Greg insisted on getting moving. Besides, it was a good way to work off lunch. With that in mind, the two of them set out from the village, though Jacob wouldn't shut up about his time in the capital city. Needless to say, Greg got annoyed quickly.

Anyway, after about half an hour, Greg spotted another Outrealm Gate in the distance.

"Huh, so there's even more of them." Greg spoke to himself.

"Should we go?" asked Jacob.

"Well, I think I've seen enough of this world for a while. Might be worth it to check out others." spoke Greg.

"Hmm, true enough."

With that said, the two of them walked into the gate, though it wasn't too long before it engulfed them in light.
1221.title: Sure, they travel somewhere new.

choices: They look to see where they are.
12211.content:
It wasn't long before the two soon lost consciousness and collapsed in the realms.

-----------

Jacob opened her eyes to see green grass by her face. Jacob quickly put herself into a standing position. She was shocked by quite a few things, first being the fact all the armor she had on. It was made up of large metal plates of great thickness. Second, was how easily she could stand while wearing the armor. It felt like air.

Third, the fact he was a SHE.

Jacob soon looked in a nearby pond in the area nearby at herself. She was a young girl with short brown hair reaching below her chin and with firm facial features. She looked through her inventory to see a Silver Lance and Silver Axe. She soon looked around and saw another girl nearby.

"What happened to me?" Jacob shrieked, feeling her own hair. Soon the girl across from her began waking up. She realized that the girl was probably Greg.

Greg was in the armor of that of a Pegasus rider. She also had two blue pigtails hanging off her head. She seemed perky and happy already as she woke up and stretched, a Silver Lance and Cure staff at her side. The two looked at one another. "Excuse me-" Greg began, but stopped when she heard a higher pitch voice. She went to the reflection as well and turned back in shock. "Wait...Jacob?!"

Jacob sighed, "Yeah. Whatever happened, we became girls."

What happens next?
12211.title: Other side of the Gate

122111.content:
"How in the world can you so calm about this?" Greg asked Jacob seriously. She was not fond of the girly voice coming of her mouth. It made her sound even younger than her actual age.

"Hmm, I don't know. Must be all that knight training. I'm used to keeping a level head." said Jacob.

"At least one of us is." pouted Greg as she looked down at the blue and silver pegasus uniform she wore. "And why did that gate turn me into a pegasus knight of all things? That's not even close to how I saw before."

"Well, mine isn't really close either. I've never worn this much armor before." replied Jacob. "Still, I'm kind of surprised it feels as light as it does."

"Whatever." Greg sighed again. Surprisingly, despite the uniform, there was no pegasus in sight. Not only that, they were in some kind of field, so where exactly were they?

"You got any idea where we are?" asked Greg.

"No clue. Never been outside my own realm remember?" said Jacob.

"Oh, right. Guess we'll start walking then." sighed Greg. With that said, the two of them began walking, albeit awkwardly thanks to the newer bodies. Greg constantly fidgeted with her uniform.

"Sheesh, I never knew these pegasus knights wore skirts like these." said Greg.

"Maybe they just feel better on their mounts or something." offered Jacob.

"Hmm, maybe." While Jacob was somewhat used to it now, Greg continued to fidget. The pigtails made her look very young, despite the fact that she was likely an older teenager at minimum. Jacob looked quite imposing in that female armor, though Greg hadn't met too many knights to this point.

What do they find?
122111.title: They look to see where they are.

13.content:
*****Rey*****

Age: 16
Appearance: Average height, red hair, blue eyes, Typical Myrmidon appearance in black (Sacred Stones style)
Class: Myrmidon
Weapons: Iron Sword, Steel Sword, Elixir.
Bio: A young teen who has been traveling through the Outrealms, hoping to discover any mysteries they hold.

*****End bio*****

Rey wiped some sweat off of his forehead, taking a breather of water. He had been traveling for quite some time. And by that, he meant about 2 weeks. Yeah, things had been a bit rough since he left his hometown. He had never been known much for being the assertive type, but he really wanted to go more about the Outrealms. Unfortunately, after one trek through a village in one world, and then another, he ended up in this desert.

"Smooth move, Rey. Nice job." He groaned sarcastically. He was only through about 3 realms now, didn't learn a thing, and was probably close to running out of water. Well, he supposed he could try to head back through the Gate, though that didn't mean he would return to that specific realm.

Well, he didn't have much else to do as he sighed. However, just as he was about to start walking, he could have sworn that he saw something down in the sand....
13.title: Traveling

131.content:
Name: Aryn (Aris currently)

Gender: Male (Female currently)

Age: 17

Class: Thief

Appearance: Brown scraggly hair, blue eyes and white skin. Blue thief outfit.

Aris laid face first in the sand. "No...hack...No more...." she coughed as she laid there. Another genderbend. Great. Just what the doctor didn't order. Just what NO ONE ordered. She laid in the desert sun, burning up. She was tired and thirsty and unaware of the boy that found her.

What happens next?
131.title: Encounter

151111.title: Ear

1511111.content: He squirms out to find a cotton swab covering his entrance. It covers him and pins him down easily. This crushes Marth and kills him. Tiki only giggles at the fact that Marth died to her earwax.
